GEORGE, BILL, FLEUR, TONKS, LUPIN, ARTHUR WEASLEY, MAD-
HEAD OF THE MUGGLE-BORN REGISTRATION COMMISSION
QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP CANCELLED AMID DEATH THREATS.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: We PUSH THROUGH THE LOGO INTO a living, breathing DAILY PROPHET. GRIM HEADLINES SAIL PAST US: Death. Paranoia. A world at war. We ZOOM INTO a MOVING PHOTOGRAPH of the Minister of Magic, RUFUS SCRIMGEOUR, standing in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. atrium of the Ministry of Magic, addressing a sea of MINISTRY EMPLOYEES as REPORTERS scribble intently.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: These are dark times, there is no denying. Our world has perhaps faced no greater threat than it does today. But I say this to our citizenry: we, ever your servants, continue to defend your liberty and repel the forces that would seek to take it from you. Your Ministry remains strong... CAMERA FAVORS a pair of wizards, YAXLEY and PIUS THICKNESSE, who turn away as we PULL OUT of the PHOTOGRAPH and SAIL once more THROUGH the turning pages, the headlines growing grimmer, the faces more HAUNTED, until, finally, we emerge from the Prophet and find it in the hands of... INT. GRANGER HOME - HERMIONE’S BEDROOM - LATE AFTERNOON (RAINING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... HERMIONE. She stares stoically at a LURID HEADLINE -- MUGGLE FAMILY MURDERED -- VIOLENCE SPREADS.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hermione. Your tea is ready, dear. Hermione glances through the doorway to the stairs beyond. Her MOTHER'S SHADOW clings to the wall, trembling within another SHADOW, that of a WIND-TOSSED TREE. It is strangely beautiful and Hermione seems transfixed...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Coming, Mum. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her mother’s SHADOW withdraws, leaving only the trembling tree. Hermione glances once more at the Prophet’s troubling headline, then slips it into a TINY BEADED BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hermione descends the stairs, MRS. GRANGER exits the kitchen with a teapot.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRANGER
dialogues.text: Don’t you look lovely. All packed? Hermione nods and watches her mother set the teapot on the table in front of the television. Just then, MR. GRANGER steps out holding a biscuit tin.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRANGER
dialogues.text: Are you sure these biscuits are sugar-free?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRANGER
dialogues.text: Quite sure, dear. See the big bold letters that say ‘Sugar Free’? Dead giveaway.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRANGER
dialogues.text: Mm. Yes. (passing Hermione) Hello, kitten. Don’t you look lovely. Hermione smiles wanly as her father gives her a peck on the head, then joins her mother on the sofa opposite the television. An AUSTRALIAN WILDLIFE PROGRAM PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -+. the bandicoot has small pointed ears and a long snout from which it emits a distinctive trumpet sound when agitated...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRANGER
dialogues.text: Darling, don’t be suspicious the biscuits taste so good, be grateful the company’s so clever... Hermione looks away from the screen, studies her mother and father. Slowly, she reaches into the tiny bag and withdraws her wand. Taking two steps forward, she points it toward the back of their heads. Hand trembling, she SPEAKS, her VOICE barely a WHISPER: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 3

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Obliviate. Mrs. Granger's face goes briefly slack and she reaches out, as if to break a fall, then, slowly, her hand drops, coming to rest upon her husband’s. He blinks once, blankly, and then... enfolds her fingers in his. Hermione lowers her arm and, eyes stinging with tears, watches the PHOTOGRAPHS placed about the room begin to CHANGE. One by one, Hermione DISAPPEARS from each.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching the beaded bag, Hermione moves down the windswept street into the dying light. We BOOM UP TO the sky, HOLD briefly, then BOOM DOWN TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +. RON, staring at the stars. He drops his gaze to the house, studies GINNY and MRS. WEASLEY, aglow in the light of the kitchen, watching them with affection, as if committing them to memory. His gaze shifts to the adjacent SHED. Inside, ARTHUR WEASLEY is bent over his workbench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weasley fiddles with a SMALL RADIO. Another half- dozen -- in various stages of repair -- stand in a line before him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What are those? Mr. Weasley turns, sees Ron standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Close the door. Ron eases inside and steps to the workbench. Mr. Weasley turns the knob on the radio before him. STATIC spits forth, then a VOICE comes clear: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 4

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ++. comes to us this evening from the north of England, where a wizard family by the name of Westinburgh were found dead in their cellar. While not a member of the Order, Mr. Westinburgh and his wife had, on numerous occasions, provided shelter for its members... Arthur switches off the radio. Gestures to the others.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: These are for the Order. So many are on the run now, it helps them to stay connected with the rest of us. Know they’re not alone... Ron studies his father’s weary face as the older man stares at his handiwork. Places his hand upon his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: C’mon. Mum’s got dinner ready. Arthur nods, pushes away from the bench and heads out the door. Ron lingers briefly, studying the radio, then follows his father into the night. We FADE. The TITLE CARD appears... and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scarlet moon. A speck -- a nightbird, or a bat -- framed in the moon’s surface, approaches rapidly, then -- WHOOSH! -- passes beneath. Far below, a sea of treetops shift eerily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PLUMMET THROUGH the shifting trees TO a narrow moonlit lane. A SHADOW ripples across the ground like a kite made of water. A BOOT touches down upon the graveled lane, then another. A cape flutters slowly down upon the shoulders of a wizard, lank hair splayed across his wind- blown collar. His head turns. Moonlight strikes his pale face. SNAPE. Moving. Up a wide drive, to a pair of wrought iron gates. Beyond, a large manor that has seen better days. A RUSTLING sounds. Snape wheels, draws his wand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A PEACOCK, white as a ghost, emerges from the yew. Snape eyes it warily, then lifts his hand. The iron gates turn to smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fractured in the prism of a diamond-paned window, Snape approaches. The front door glides open. As he enters, dark eyes in torch-lit portraits track him from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door looms at the end of a hallway. Reaching it, Snape hesitates for a heartbeat, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen figures sit silently at a large ornate table, illuminated by the flickering light of a fireplace. Snape studies the scene, then his eyes rise. Revolving slowly near the ceiling, as if suspended by an invisible rope, is an unconscious WOMAN (CHARITY BURBAGE).

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Severus. I was beginning to worry you'd lost your way. Come. I’ve saved you a seat. VOLDEMORT grins, silhouetted against the fire, and gestures to the seat nearest his own. All eyes follow Snape, all except DRACO MALFOY, who nervously stares at the body above and a haggard LUCIUS MALFOY, who merely stares vaguely at his wand while his wife NARCISSA looks straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: You know our hosts, of course, Severus. Narcissa in particular has been most hospitable. Lucius, on the other hand, is, I fear, burdened by my presence. Are you, Lucius?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: My lord?

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Are you burdened?

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA MALFOY
dialogues.text: My lord is always welcome here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Voldemort smiles, his eyes shifting to Snape, who watches the great snake NAGINI as she slopes slowly over the feet of those present, unnerving all.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: You bring news I trust, Severus?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: It will happen Saturday next. At nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: And this information comes --

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: -- from the source we discussed. Yaxley, the wizard seen at the Ministry, leans into the flickering light from the opposite end of the table.

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: I have heard differently, my lord. Dawlish, the Auror, let slip that the Potter boy will not be moved until the thirtieth of this month, the night before he turns seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: This is a false trail. The Auror Office no longer plays any part in the protection of Harry Potter. Those closest to him believe we have infiltrated the Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAT MAN
dialogues.text: Well, they’ve got that right, then, ‘aven’t they? As the Squat Man cackles wheezily, others join in. Voldemort raises a hand. All goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Pius, what say you? PIUS THICKNESSE looks up, his gaze placid.

dialogues.speaker: THICKNESSE
dialogues.text: One hears many things, my lord. Whether the truth is among them is not clear. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 7

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Spoken like a true politician. You will, I think, prove most useful, Pius. Where will he be taken? The boy?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: To a safehouse. Likely the home of someone in the Order. I’m told it has been given every manner of protection possible. Once there, it will be impractical to attack him. We may have compromised the Ministry, but there are those who remain loyal to him. As long as the Ministry stands, his allies within will have the means at their disposal to insure his safety.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: My lord, if I might, I’d like to volunteer myself for this task. I'd like to kill the boy. Just then a WAIL rises from the floorboards. Voldemort’s eyes flash briefly with RED.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Wormtail! Have I not spoken to you about keeping our guest quiet?

dialogues.speaker: WORMTAIL
dialogues.text: Yes, m-my lord. Right away, my lord. As WORMTAIL scrambles up, Voldemort returns his gaze to BELLATRIX.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: As inspiring as I find your bloodlust, Bellatrix, I must be the one to kill Harry Potter. But I face an unfortunate complication. It has recently come to my attention that my wand and Potter’s share the same core. They are, in some ways, twins. We can wound but not fatally harm one another. Which means, if I am to kill him... I will have to do it with another's wand. The others at the table stir nervously. Bellatrix stiffens. Voldemort’s narrow eyes rake the room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Come now. Surely one of you would like the honor? What about... you, Lucius? Lucius peers up, sallow and beaten. 6/11/10 7A. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12  12 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: I require your wand. Lucius sits mute, paralyzed by the request, scanning the faces of the others, who avoid his gaze, all but Snape, who regards him with naked contempt and Draco, whose eyes meet his briefly, then glance away. Finally Narcissa’s fingers lightly graze his wrist, summoning him back to the moment. Turning, he watches as, almost imperceptibly, she nods. Lowering his head, he ROLLS his wand slowly across the table, where it stops at Voldemort’s skeletal hand. Voldemort holds the wand to the light.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Do I detect elm?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Yes, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: And the core?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Dragon -- dragon heartstring. Voldemort nods, getting a feel for the wand’s heft, then his eyes shift, catch Lucius staring at the WAND on the table -- Voldemort’s own.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: My wand? You can’t possibly think I would give you my wand. Lucius’ eyes meet Voldemort’s. For a moment he is speechless. Finally his chin drops.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: No, my lord. Voldemort studies Lucius’ bowed head, then returns his attention to the wand in his hand. Raising it, he points it at the body above. With a FLICK, the body awakens, TWITCHING against its invisible bonds.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: For those of you who do not know, we are joined tonight by Miss Charity Burbage who until recently taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Her specialty was Muggle studies. It is Miss Burbage’s belief that Muggles are not so different from us. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She would, given her way, have us mate with them. To her, the mixture of magical and Muggle blood is not an abomination but something to be encouraged. I, of course, take a contrary view. But we're all civilized here. All adults. We can agree to disagree. Charity’s tear-streaked face revolves once more to face Snape, her voice hoarse with fear.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Severus, please. We’re friends... Snape’s face remains impassive. Voldemort’s eyes narrow to scarlet slits... his voice HISSES. Draco watches a teardrop strike the table...

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Avada Kedavra! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 14 15 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 9.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GREEN LIGHT envelops the room. Charity plummets to the table, body still. Voldemort ponders the wand, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Nagini... Dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blood-red sky hangs over the neighborhood. INT. DURSLEY HOUSE - HARRY’S BEDROOM - SAME TIME - DUSK 1 An EYE shimmers in a SHARD of SILVERED GLASS. HARRY POTTER'S eye. He tosses the mirror inside a LUMPY RUCKSACK, than adds a LOCKET, a Daily Prophet CLIPPING entitled “Dumbledore Remembered” (above which is a PHOTOGRAPH of its author, ELPHIAS DOGE with DUMBLEDORE) and a NOTEBOOK filled with scribblings on Horcruxes and, in large block letters, the initials “R.A.B.” He gives the rucksack a shake, then glances about to see if he’s forgotten anything. The room looks as if it’s been bottled up and shaken. Dresser drawers turned out, floor covered in detritus.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come now, Dudley. Hurry up! Harry steps to the window, peers to the driveway below. UNCLE VERNON rolls a large STEAMER TRUNK towards his car, followed by DUDLEY, who tugs an equally large TRUNK of his own. Harry speaks to HEDWIG.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Time for the teary farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry drops down the stairs. The house feels barren, desolate. Aunt Petunia stands at the mouth of the kitchen, looking around. Seeing her, Harry comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: I've lived in this house twenty years. And now -- in a single night -- I’m expected to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They’1l torture you. Even Dudley. If they think you know where I’m going, they’1ll stop at noth-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 16 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: You think I don’t know that? You think I don’t know what they’re capable of? Her eyes pierce Harry's.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: You didn’t just lose a mother that night in Godric’s Hollow, you know. I lost a sister. Harry studies her, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you have any? Magic?

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: What a cruel thing to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Vernon tests the strap binding the trunks to a small TRAILER hitched to the back of the Dursley car, then squints awkwardly at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Well, this is goodbye then, boy. Harry, standing by the front door, nods, eyes Petunia, who sits in the front passenger seat, a ghost behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. Isn’t he coming with us?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Well, because -- he doesn’t want to, do you, boy? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 18 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Besides, I’m just a waste of space. Isn’t that right, Vernon? Uncle Vernon stares hard at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Come on, Dudley, we're off. Uncle Vernon starts for the car. Dudley hesitates, then crosses the lawn to Harry, extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’re a waste of space.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well... thanks. Harry grips Dudley’s hand, then watches his cousin turn and lope back across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) See you, Big D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands, rucksack over his shoulder, Hedwig’s cage in hand. Somewhere, nearby, a CLOCK TICKS. Otherwise, all is still. Utterly quiet. He glances about the house, full of shadows, like ghosts. His eyes burn with bitterness.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good riddance. His eyes shift. The last rays of sunlight lay, like a stain, upon a SMALL CUPBOARD DOOR below the stairs. He lets the rucksack slip from his shoulder. Sets down the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Harry’s face appears. Motes of dust dance before his eyes. He peers into the shadows, into his past. A DEAD SPIDER hangs within an ancient web. A REGIMENT of TOY SOLDIERS -- broken and draped with dust -- line a listing shelf. As the SUN withdraws from the hallway, a tremor passes through Harry’s face and then... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19 20 21 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A TREMENDOUS ROAR murders the silence, the roar of a MOTOR BIKE. Harry straightens -- half-believing he’s dreamed it into existence -- and STRIKES his head on the low door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pelts down the dark hall as OPAQUE SHAPES race past the windows. He trips past Hedwig’s cage, sending it WOBBLING and flings open the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERMIONE flings her arms around Harry. RON gives hima clap on the back. Others emerge from the shadows: FRED,

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, BILL, FLEUR, TONKS, LUPIN, ARTHUR WEASLEY, MAD-
dialogues.text: EYE MOODY, KINGSLEY SHACKLEBOLT and a small, dirty, hangdog man, MUNDUNGUS FLETCHER. Lastly, HAGRID dismounts a MOTORBIKE, strips a pair of fly-specked goggles from his face and yanks a SMALL TWITTERING BIRD from his beard.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: All righ’, ‘arry? Yeh look fit.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s ruddy gorgeous. What say we get undercover before someone murders him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone spills down the hallway into the sitting room.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I thought you were looking after the Prime Minister, Kingsley.

dialogues.speaker: SHACKLEBOLT
dialogues.text: You're more important. Harry grins, then a tall, red-headed man (BILL WEASLEY) is before him, hand extended. His face is horribly SCARRED.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry. Bill Weasley.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wasn’t always this handsome. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Dead ugly.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (smiling; to Harry) True enough. Owe it all toa werewolf by name of Greyback. Hope to repay the favor one day.

dialogues.speaker: FLEUR
dialogues.text: (a kiss to the cheek) You are still beautiful to me, William.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Just remember, Fleur, once you’re married: Bill takes his steaks on the raw side now.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: My husband, the joker. By the way, wait until you hear the news! Remus and I are --

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: All right, all right! You’ll all have time for a cozy catch-up later! We’ve got to get the hell out of here and soon! Moody drops some SACKS at his feet. Turns to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Potter, you’re underage, which means you’ve still got the Trace on you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Trace?

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: You sneeze and the Ministry will know who wipes your nose. Point is, we have to use those means of transport the Trace can’t detect: brooms, thestrals and the like. We'll go in pairs. That way if anyone’s out there waiting for us -- and I reckon there will be -- they won’t know which Harry Potter is the real one.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The real one...? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moody draws a FLASK from his cloak.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: I believe you're familiar with this particular brew.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! Absolutely not!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (a sigh) I told you he'd take it well.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If you think I’m going to let people risk their lives for me --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Never done that before, have we?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is different. Taking that. Becoming me -- no.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, none of us really fancy it, mate.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, imagine if something went wrong and we were stuck as scrawny, specky gits forever.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Everyone here’s of age, Potter, and they’ve all agreed to take the risk.

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: Technically, I’ve been coerced. (turning to Harry and extending his hand) Mundungus Fletcher, Mr. Potter. I’ve always been a huge admirer.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Nip it, Mundungus! All right, Granger, as discussed. Hermione grabs a tuft of Harry’s hair -- yanks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Blimey, Hermione! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Straight in here, if you please. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 15

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Moody holds out the flask, un-stoppered now. The potion inside begins to spit forth smoke. He hands it to George.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: For those of you who haven’t taken Polyjuice Potion before, fair warning. It tastes like goblin piss.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Have a lot of experience with that, do you, Mad-Eye? Moody's eye rotates menacingly onto Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Just trying to defuse the tension. Fred takes the flask from George, followed by Ron, Hermione, Fleur and a less than overjoyed Mundungus. He scowls as the potion trickles past his lips and seconds later, his features -- like those of the others -- begin to bubble like hot wax. As the transformation completes, seven Harry Potters stand in the tiny kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Wow -- we're identical!

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Not yet you aren’t. Moody pulls the ties on the SACKS and pulls out SEVEN IDENTICAL OUTFITS.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t have something a bit more sporty, do you?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Yes, don’t fancy this color at all.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Fancy this: You’re not you, so shut it and strip. (to Harry) You'll need to change too, Potter. Harry, a bit self-consciously, begins to strip down. The others, meanwhile, appear unconcerned to be exposing Harry's body.

dialogues.speaker: FLEUR
dialogues.text: Bill, look away -- I’m ‘ideous. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (smirking) I knew Ginny was lying about that tattoo. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 22 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 16

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (wobbling a bit) Harry, your eyesight really is awful.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Blimey. I almost forgot. Mad-Eye rummages in his pocket, pulls out a fistful of EYE-GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Right then. We'll be pairing off. Each Potter will have a protector. As for you, Harry...

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: The real Harry! Where the devil are you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here. Moody's eye rotates onto the real Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: You'll ride with Hagrid.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Brought yeh here sixteen years ago when you were barely bigger than a Bowtruckle. Seems only righ’ I should be the one ter take yeh away.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s all very touching. Let’s go. As they file out, grabs his rucksack and ponders Hedwig in her cage. He snaps open the wire door and she flutters out, swoops down the hallway and soars out the open door. Harry glances once more down the hall, at the cupboard under the stairs, then exits. He HOLD ON Hedwig’s empty cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other six Harrys sit upon thestrals and brooms. Hagrid sits astride a motorbike, goggles on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the real Harry appears, Hagrid taps the sidecar and Harry drops in.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE
dialogues.text: Good luck, everyone. On the count of three. One... two -- Hagrid kicks the motorbike to life, lurches forward. Hedwig swoops upward and beats toward the greasy moon. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 23 24 25 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 17

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Hagrid roars into the sky, Harry twists round, watching one Harry Potter after another whip past, watching Privet Drive grow smaller, his eyes stinging in the wind, briefly lost in the moment, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a DISTURBANCE FILLS THE AIR. Harry turns away, looks up. DEATH EATERS drop from the clouds, surround the others. FLASHES of GREEN LIGHT splinter the darkness. Sparks explode on the bike’s chassis and Hagrid HOWLS in fury.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid! We’ve got to help the others!

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Can't do it, ‘arry. My job’s ter get you where we’re goin’ safe ‘n sound -- Mad-Eye’s orders! Before Harry can reply, FOUR DEATH EATERS jet out of the darkness, robes snapping in the wind. As one, their wands rise. Hagrid slams his hand onto a PURPLE BUTTON. With an EAR-SHATTERING BLAST, the motorbike quivers and FLAMES BELCH from the exhaust pipe. The Death Eaters SCREAM, robes afire, and pinwheel away, freefalling towards the earth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Dragon fire! More DEATH EATERS SWOOP from the sky, give chase. Hagrid DIVES, plummeting for the ground, trying desperately to shake them. Harry watches the earth rushing towards them, grimacing as the bike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. SLAMS onto the asphalt and slaloms wildly as Hagrid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... roars into a tunnel, the Death Eaters still in pursuit. Hagrid leans wildly from side to side, eluding the flashes of light from the Death Eaters’ wands. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 26 27 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 18

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sparks skitter off the tunnel and shower down as the sidecar rides up into the air repeatedly, then slams down onto the roadway. Harry glances back, sees the Death Eaters closing when LIGHT FILLS THE TUNNEL and HAGRID ROARS. Turning back, Harry sees a HUGE LORRY rushing towards them. As the HEADLIGHTS GROW LARGE, Hagrid steers the motorbike directly into them -- then past -- and up the rounded side of the tunnel. The motorbike loops-the-loop and Harry dangles briefly, watching -- upside down -- as two Death Eaters fly smack into the lorry -- before the motorbike comes round right side up, shoots out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .+. of the tunnel and soars back into the starry sky. Hagrid and Harry soar higher, the air CRACKLING with ELECTRICITY as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... MASSIVE ELECTRICAL PYLONS appear in the darkness. As Hagrid weaves through the towers, a gang of Death Eaters jet INTO VIEW. Harry fires a volley of Stunning Spells, sending a pair of Death Eaters into the SIZZLING wires where they dangle briefly, spasming, before plummeting into the darkness. Harry fires again and watches two others take evasive measures... unaware of the Death Eater closing in from behind. Finally he turns. The Death Eater grins, wand twitching, when... Hedwig swoops down, flaying the Death Eater’s wand hand. Harry grins triumphantly when... a mad volley of WAND BLASTS ricochet off the motorbike and Hedwig is gone. Harry glances about desperately, when:

dialogues.speaker: DEATH EATER
dialogues.text: That’s him! The real one! The remaining Death Eaters fall back and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Hol’ tight, ‘arry! We've got ter get yeh out of here! Hagrid hits the purple button again and the motorbike rockets forth. Harry gazes bleakly behind... then winces, eyes rolling back in his head. Gripping his scar, he squints toward the horizon and sees something closing on them. It looks like smoke, then begins to take shape. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 19

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Voldemort. Flying. Slowly, Harry raises his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid... HAGRID...! Harry lets out a primal scream, his eyes clenched shut in pain, his wand hand trembling as he points it blindly. Voldemort’s snake-like face draws near, his wand trained on Harry. Harry’s arm goes slack, his wand dropping...

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Avada... Abruptly, Harry’s arm rises as if on a string, drawn up by the wand trembling in his hand. GOLD FIRE spits forth and -- Crack! -- SPARKS skitter up the chassis of the motorbike. Harry wheels and -- for a split second -- is face to face with Voldemort, whose eyes drift, staring -- with something like fear -- at Harry’s wand. Then -- whoosh! -- Voldemort peels backward and away, evaporating like smoke. Just then... «+. the motorbike’s engine HICCUPS and Hagrid and Harry begin to drop. PUTT... PUTT... PUTT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorbike splashes down into the reeds, sputters, then cuts out altogether in a SMOKING HISSSSS. Harry glances about. A door opens in a crooked house. TWO SILHOUETTES appear, dash forward -- MRS. WEASLEY and GINNY.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry! Hagrid! What happened?! Have you seen the others?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is no one back yet? He looks from Mrs. Weasley to Ginny. Ginny shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: They were on us from the star’, Molly -- the Death Eaters. And You-Know-Who as well. Molly Weasley’s face betrays panic, but she fights it back.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Well, thank goodness you two are all right. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 20

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Haven't go’ any brandy, have yeh, Molly? Fer medicinal purposes? She nods, leads him toward the house. Once out of earshot, Harry turns expectantly to Ginny. She looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Ron and Tonks should've already been back. Dad and Fred as well. Suddenly, several yards away, a BLUE LIGHT burns in the darkness. Harry and Ginny rush towards it just as Lupin materializes, cradling an unconscious “Harry,” clothes torn, head awash in BLOOD. Harry takes in the surreal tableau, then watches “himself” transform into George, who bears the true damage. Ginny’s hands fly to her face.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Oh my God! George!

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: The house! Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupin and Harry drop George onto the sofa, where his head rolls into the lamplight, the blood more shocking here. Molly Weasley screams. George’s ear is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: My boy! My darling boy! What’ve they done to you?! Harry looks on miserably -- anger and guilt clashing within him -- when Lupin grabs a fistful of his shirt and hurls him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Remus! What’re you doing!

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: What creature sat in the corner the first time that Harry Potter visited my office at Hogwarts!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are you mad...? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 2

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A grindylow! Lupin releases Harry, turns back to the others.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: We've been betrayed. Voldemort knew you were being moved tonight. I had to make sure you weren’t an imposter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who did this to him?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Snape. (nodding to George) He'll be fine, Molly. But that’s Dark Magic. The damage is done. She simply nods, weeping, dabbing at George’s face. A blue glow glimmers against the window, where Hagrid stands.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Someone else is back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione and Kingsley stand together, looking shaken. As the others rush forward, Kingsley points his wand at Lupin.

dialogues.speaker: SHACKLEBOLT
dialogues.text: The last words Albus Dumbledore spoke to the pair of us?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: ‘Harry is the best hope we have. Trust him.’ Shacklebolt lowers his wand, wheels on Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SHACKLEBOLT
dialogues.text: What gave you away?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hedwig -- I think. She was trying to protect me -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 31 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 22

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then, the yard glows with BLUE LIGHT and one pair after another materialize: Fred & Mr. Weasley, Bill & Fleur, Ron & Tonks. Ron is still “Harry,” but Hermione doesn’t hesitate, enveloping him in a fierce hug. As he transforms back into his own battle-weary self, he looks mildly abashed to be in such close proximity to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hey ya -- Well... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Deserves that. Brilliant, he was. Wouldn't be standing here without him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (breaking free of her) Always the tone of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Are we the last? Where’s George? Suddenly... silence. Mr. Weasley eyes all, turns to Lupin.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Remus. Where’s my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur Weasley, trailed by the others, stops dead. Molly looks up, her face saying it all. Fred comes up on his father’s shoulder, eyes stinging with tears as he sees his brother. As if sensing them, George stirs.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: How do you feel, Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Saint-like.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Come again? George opens his eyes, lifts a blood-crusted finger, and points to the dark cavity in the side of his skull.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Saint-like... You see, I’m holy. Holey, Fred, geddit? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 2

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: With the whole wide world of ear- related humor at your disposal, you go for holey? Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Reckon I’m still better-looking than you. Better-looking than Bill, that’s for sure. Bill doesn't smile. Next to him, Fleur looks equally grim.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Mad-Eye’s dead. The room goes still.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Mundungus took one look at Voldemort and Disapparated.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Mad-Eye reckoned You-Know-Who would expect the real Harry to be with the most skilled Auror. He knew he’d be in the most danger.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t explain how they knew we were moving Harry tonight. The room grows quiet. Eyes shift.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Wha’? One of us? Tha’s mad. I’d wager me life it wasn’ none of you lot. An’ if it was me I’d kno’, wouldn’ I? Talk in me sleep on occasion, I’1l admit, but there’s only Fang aroun’ ter hear an’ mostly it’s gibberish an’ besides I’d cut me tongue out ‘fore ‘d betray ‘arry e’en in me dreams -- Hagrid stops, blinking miserably. Suddenly, all smile.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Wha’s so funny!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I trust you with my life, Hagrid. I trust everyone in this room. Understood? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 32 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: ‘Ear, ‘ear. Fred nods approvingly to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Better.

31 32  33 34 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 INT. RON’S ROOM - NIGHT (LATER) Shadows cling to the ceiling. Harry tosses fitfully, something bedeviling his sleep. Suddenly, his SCAR CONTRACTS. He GRIMACES.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You lied to me, Ollivander!
33 34 At the bottom of a run of rotting wooden stairs, Wormtail props up an emaciated OLLIVANDER. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 25

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the cracked surface of a TALL MIRROR, we see Voldemort reflected at the top of the stairs -- an angry silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: OLLIVANDER
dialogues.text: No! No! I believed a different wand would work, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMONT
dialogues.text: Then explain this! Voldemort extends his skeletal fingers. Lucius Malfoy’s wand lies shattered upon his ghostly skin.

dialogues.speaker: OLLIVANDER
dialogues.text: But it makes no sense...

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Perhaps our friend's loyalties lie elsewhere, Wormtail. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 35B
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 26

dialogues.speaker: OLLIVANDER
dialogues.text: No! There must be a way! I/’11 think of something else!

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMONT
dialogues.text: I hope so, Ollivander, for your sake. I won’t be so forgiving next time... INT. RON’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT 35 Harry awakens with a GASP, eyes flashing in the darkness. He eyes the shadows above him, then looks down at his hand where his wand glimmers in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rucksack slung over his shoulder, Harry picks his way softly down the spiraling steps, past silent doorways, slipping in and out of shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry emerges into the night, shifting the rucksack as he eyes the reeds shifting eerily in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Going somewhere? Harry stiffens, turns to meet Ron’s accusatory gaze, then continues on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No one else is going to die. Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: For you? You think Madeye died for you? You think George took that curse for you? You may be the Chosen One, mate, but this is a whole lot bigger than that. Harry stares at Ron. The air is tense.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come with me. Now.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And leave Hermione? Are you mad? We wouldn’t last two days without her. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 2

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (glancing around) Don’t tell her I said that. (back to Harry) Besides, you’ve still got the Trace on you. And there’s the wedding...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wedding?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bill and Fleur. Mum’s been planning it for months. Only thing that’s kept her sane, I reckon. She’ll kill me if I miss it. Kill you too. Rather go face to face with You-Know-Who if I’m honest. Ron tries a smile, but Harry looks foul.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t care about a bloody wedding -- no matter whose it is. I have to start searching for the Horcruxes. It’s the only chance we have to beat him. And the longer we wait the stronger he gets. Ron just stares at Harry, calm, poised.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Tonight’s not the night, mate. You'd only be doing him a favor. Harry stares at Ron -- incensed by his cool demeanor and common sense. Finally, he turns away, tosses the rucksack in frustration. For a moment they stand like this, Harry’s back to Ron. Silent. Finally Ron speaks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do you think he knows? Harry turns his head halfway, but doesn’t speak.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I mean, they’re bits of his soul, the Horcruxes. Bits of him. When Dumbledore destroyed the ring and you destroyed Tom Riddle’s diary all those years ago -- he must’ve felt something right? Harry ponders this, but remains silent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 37 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 26

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What I’m saying is, if we do this thing right, if we find the Horcruxes and begin to destroy them one by one... Harry waits.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Won’t he know he’s being hunted? Still Harry says nothing. Silence descends once more, then:

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All together now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird's-eye view: An ENORMOUS CIRCLE of SILK lies flat upon the ground. As Hagrid looks on, Arthur, Bill, Ron and Fred stand on its periphery, wands poised.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three! The silk rises, pitching itself into a perfect wedding marquee, trembling wondrously in the morning breeze... then collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DAILY PROPHET lies in f.g., HEADLINE SCREAMING: “DUMBLEDORE’S DARK SECRETS.” We HEAR FOOTSTEPS descend the stairs... then Harry’s blurry figure steps INTO FOCUS and takes the paper for a closer inspection. RITA SKEETER grins up at him, holding a BOOK entitled The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore. A bit further down, another headline: “Think You Know Dumbledore? Think Again!”

dialogues.speaker: GINNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Were you going to tell me? Harry turns, finds Ginny in the doorway in a beautiful dress.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 38 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 27

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: And Ron and Hermione. They’1l not be going back to Hogwarts either? Harry stares at her. She looks excruciatingly beautiful in the light streaming through the window.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dumbledore didn’t want anyone to know what it is we're doing. If I tell you, I’d be betraying him.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Zip me up, will you. She turns. The dress is open to the small of her back. Harry steps forward and takes the zipper. As the panels close, concealing her skin, his fingers linger at the top, lightly brushing the nape of her neck. They stand like this, utterly still, the moment fraught.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Seems silly, doesn’t it? A wedding. Given everything that’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s the best reason to have it. Because of everything that’s going on. Her chin turns, coming into profile, her face very close. Then she folds into him and they are kissing. Long. Deep. George wanders in brushing his teeth, pours himself a cup of tea and, sticking the toothbrush in his ear-hole, leans back against the stove for a sip. Ginny -- sensing something -- opens her eyes and JUMPS. Harry wheels. George winks, tips his cup in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stands looking at the marquee from his POV: perfect.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: How’s it look on your end, boys? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 39 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 28

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron and Fred look: bent, mangled.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Brilliant! Just then, the silk snaps and the trees in the surrounding orchard shiver in a rush of wind. Everyone steps clear of the marquee and watches a TALL WIZARD with GRIZZLED HAIR and SCARRED CHEEK materialize. RUFUS SCRIMGEOUR.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, what’s the Minister of Magic doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dunno. But something tells me he didn’t come to give away the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry enters, trailed by Ron and Hermione. Scrimgeour gestures the trio to the sofa. Harry eyes Scrimgeour with thinly concealed contempt.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: To what do we owe the pleasure, Minister?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: I think we both know the answer to that question, Mr. Potter. Scrimgeour pitches a CLOTH BAG onto the table before them. The trio regard it curiously, exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And this would be...?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: Don’t be coy, Mr. Potter. Mr. Weasley. Would you say you were close to your former Headmaster?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dumbledore? And me? I dunno. I reckon I was just another Weasley to him. He was always polite --

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: And you, Miss Granger? How would you characterize your relationship? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 2

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We were friendly, not close like Harry, but --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s this all about?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: This. Despite the fact that neither of your friends appear to have been particularly close to their recently deceased Headmaster, he saw fit to remember them in his will. Now why do you suppose that would be? Harry, Ron and Hermione exchange glances again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: Come now, you don’t expect me to believe... Scrimgeour reaches into his cloak, removes a SCROLL OF

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: ‘Herein is set forth the Last Will and Testament of Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore. First, to Ronald Bilius Weasley, I leave my Deluminator, a device of my own making, in the hope that -- when things seem most dark -- it will show him the light.’ Scrimgeour removes a SMALL SILVER OBJECT from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dumbledore left this? For me? Brilliant. Er -- what is it? Ron CLICKS it and all the light rushes from the lamps into the Deluminator, throwing the room into total darkness. He CLICKS it again and light flies back to the lamps.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wicked. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 30

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: ‘To Miss Hermione Jean Granger, I leave my copy of The Tales of Beedle the Bard, in the hope that she will find it entertaining and instructive.’ Scrimgeour reaches into the bag once again and retrieves a SMALL BOOK, its binding stained and peeling in places.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Mum used to read me those! The Wizard and the Hopping Pot, Babbitty Rabbity and her Cackling Stump... Harry and Hermione stare blankly at him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oh, c’mon! Beedle’s stories are famous! Babbity Rabbitty? No...? Scrimgeour eyes Ron with mild annoyance, continues.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: ‘To Harry James Potter, I leave the Snitch he caught in his first Quidditch match at Hogwarts, as a reminder of the rewards of perseverance and skill. Scrimgeour places the tiny golden orb onto Harry’s palm, where it glimmers dully. Harry studies it, then looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s it then?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: Not quite. Dumbledore left you a second bequest: The Sword of Godric Gryffindor. Unfortunately, the Sword of Gryffindor was not Dumbledore’s to give away. As an important historical artifact, it belongs...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: To Harry! It belongs to Harry! It chose him! It came to him in the Chamber of Secrets when he most needed it! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 40 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 31

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: The sword may present itself to any worthy Gryffindor, Miss Granger. That does not make it that wizard’s property. And in any event the current whereabouts of the sword are unknown.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: The sword is missing. (before Harry can pursue) I won’t pretend to be your friend, Mr. Potter. But I assure you I’m not your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You'll forgive me, Minister. But it’s a little hard to tell the difference these days.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: Dumbledore said something very similar the last time we spoke. Scrimgeour gazes out the window, eyes haunted.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where is your guard, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMGEOUR
dialogues.text: I came alone. I don’t really need them anymore... He turns then, exits. MUSIC IS HEARD and LAUGHTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding party is in full swing. Harry, in dress robes, stands on the periphery, absently FINGERING THE SNITCH as Bill and Fleur twirl madly within a clapping circle of well-wishers. Harry's gaze drifts: to Ginny, laughing as Fred and George rush the dance floor, briefly sweep Fleur away from Bill, then begin to dance with each other; to Hermione, stunning in black silk: to Ron, who ignores all, his eyes focused entirely on Hermione. Far across the garden, Hagrid wends through the tables in his horrible hairy suit and presents a SLICE OF CAKE to a pleased OLYMPE MAXIME. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 32

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nearby, Tonks, hand to her belly, leans forward and WHISPERS something to Mrs. Weasley, who reacts with happy surprise. Harry studies Tonks’ belly...

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We want you to be the godfather. Harry turns, sees Lupin standing behind, staring at Tonks with affection. As his eyes shift to Harry, Harry sputters:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean -- But that’s brilliant -- I... don’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Say yes. Lupin grins, claps Harry on the shoulder and hikes off into the darkness, joining the WIZARDS STANDING GUARD in the garden’s deepest shadows. Harry looks back to Tonks, then notices a slight, TUFTY-HAIRED WIZARD (ELPHIAS DOGE) sitting alone at a table just beyond her.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry! LUNA LOVEGOOD approaches in the company of a cross-eyed wizard (XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD) with shoulder-length white hair the texture of candy floss. Both wear robes the color of egg yolk.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Oh, I’ve interrupted a deep thought, haven’t I? I can see it growing smaller in your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, ‘course not. How are you, Luna?

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Very well. I was bitten by a garden gnome only moments ago. She holds up her finger, which is sheathed in blood.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Gnome saliva is enormously beneficial! Xenophilius Lovegood. We live just over the hill!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, sir. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 3

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lovegood suddenly leans close, WHISPERS FIERCELY:

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: I trust you know, Mr. Potter, that we at The Quibbler, unlike those toadies at the Daily Prophet, fully supported Dumbledore during his lifetime and in his death support you just as fully.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Come, Daddy. Harry doesn’t want to talk to us right now. He’s just too nice to say so. Lovegood’s eyes burn with righteousness, a TRIANGULAR EYE dangling from a chain around his neck. As Luna pulls him away, Harry glances once again across the garden.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ELPHIAS DOGE sits alone, smiling absently as he observes the happy goings-on. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir? May I sit down?

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Potter! By all means! In a nervous flutter, Doge pours Harry a goblet of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I found what you wrote in the Daily Prophet very moving, sir. I take it you knew Professor Dumbledore well?

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: I certainly knew him the longest, if you don’t count his brother Aberforth -- and somehow, people never do seem to count Aberforth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I never even knew he had a brother, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: Yes, well, Dumbledore was always very private. Even as a boy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 3

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir, I was wondering if you'd had much contact with him before he died.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: The occasional owl. Though it was strange...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Strange, sir?

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: It was the owls themselves. They often arrived in distress. It was clear they’d traveled great distances in some cases.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Could you tell me from where they’d come, sir?

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: I’m afraid not. Albus’ messages mostly referenced our days together as schoolboys. They were surprisingly intimate. When he did speak of his current activities his words would turn elliptical. Still, I sensed he was under great stress. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just curious. I was... close to Professor Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: Well, he treasured you, Mr. Potter, I can attest to that. I can also tell you that when a person passes, it’s only natural to rue the things left unsaid, to regret the question never asked. I knew Albus nigh on 100 years, but in many ways he will always remain a riddle even to me.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't despair, Elphias. I’m told he’s been thoroughly unriddled by Rita Skeeter. In 800 pages no less. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 35

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry and Doge turn, study the profile of an ANCIENT WITCH (MURIEL) sitting at an adjacent table, a glass of champagne cradled in the bony fingers of one hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: That woman is a vulture, Muriel, and you well know it.

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: Someone has to pick the bones to get at the truth. I read your obituary, Elphias. Lovely. But you did skate over some of the sticky patches in Dumbledore’s life.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you think so, Muriel. I assure you I was writing from the heart.

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: Yes, well, Rita Skeeter hasn’t made that mistake, I’m sure. Word has it someone talked to her, someone who knew the Dumbledore family well. You and I both know who that is, Elphias.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: A monstrous betrayal. I can only conclude the rumors are true and that she has become untethered.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t suppose it’ll be a secret once the book comes out. (relishing the moment ) Bathilda Bagshot.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: Who? Bathilda Bagshot! My god, boy, she’s only the most celebrated magical historian of the last century. Don’t they read History of Magic at Hogwarts anymore? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 3

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Slipped my mind...

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: She knew the Dumbledores as well as anyone. She’d have letters, perhaps an interesting photograph or two. I’m sure Rita Skeeter would have thought it well worth a trip to Godric’s Hollow to take a peek into that old bird's rattled cage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Godric’s Hollow? Bathilda Bagshot lives in Godric’s Hollow?

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: For years now. That’s where she first met Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? You don’t mean to say Dumbledore lived there too?

dialogues.speaker: MURIEL
dialogues.text: Of course. The family moved there after his father killed those three Muggles. It was quite the scandal. (eyeing him) Honestly, my boy, are you sure you knew him at all? Harry sits, speechless, then his eye catches a shooting star -- or what appears to be. As it plummets, it grows, gaining speed until it slices through the canopy, exploding in a burst of light. All goes SILENT as a SILVER LYNX -- graceful and gleaming -- MATERIALIZES amid the crowd. When it speaks, the Patronus has Shacklebolt’s sonorous voice.

dialogues.speaker: PATRONUS
dialogues.text: The Ministry has fallen. The Minister of Magic is dead. They are coming... The lynx vanishes. A SCREAM shreds the silence. Then: chaos.

dialogues.speaker: ELPHIAS DOGE
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, Mr. Potter! Doge extends his hand toward Harry when -- CRACK! -- he DISAPPARATES. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 4l HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 37

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Seconds later, the ancient witch has done the same. Harry scans the scattering crowd and meets Ginny’s eyes, as she gets buffeted about. He pelts toward her, bouncing between bodies, losing sight of her.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! Ron! Harry turns, sees Hermione glancing about frantically. As she turns, Ron comes INTO VIEW, pushes toward her. Suddenly the canopy above turns to ribbons as DEATH EATERS -- in dark cloaks and masks -- descend into the crowd. Arthur, Fred and George wield their wands. Harry sees a flower fall from Fleur’s hair, watches it crushed underfoot, then catches sight of Ginny through the madness as she draws her own wand, copper hair gleaming, eyes flashing. He starts toward her, when... Lupin crashes in, spinning him roughly round.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry! Go! Gol! A HAND REACHES OUT AND GRABS HIS. He looks. It’s Hermione, clutching Ron’s hand with her other. She closes her eyes and a great WHOOSHING SOUND fills Harry’s ears. He takes one last desperate look at Ginny as he is thrown up and back in a WHIRLWIND and all goes BLACK. A HORN BLARES as... EXT. SHAFTESBURY AVENUE (PICCADILLY) - NIGHT 4l «+. a DOUBLE-DECKER BUS careens within inches of Harry, Ron and Hermione as they stumble INTO VIEW, the streets teeming with drunken pub crawlers.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Shaftesbury Avenue. I used to come here to the theater with my mum and dad. Just popped into my head. I don’t know why... They hurry on, glancing over their shoulders at the DARK SHAPES that move within the crowd behind them, STRANGERS bumping by, FACES passing in a paranoiac BLUR: a DRUNKEN MAN, a CACKLING WOMAN with BLOOD-RED LIPSTICK...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: This way! HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they take refuge in the shadows, Hermione begins to rummage through her TINY BEADED PURSE.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We need to change. Ron and Harry look at each other’s dress robes. From the purse, Hermione extracts -- in quick succession -- two pairs of jeans, T-shirts, and a pair of light overcoats.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How the ruddy --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Undetectable Extension Charm.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're amazing, you are.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Always the tone of surprise. As she gives the bag a shake, there is LOUD echoing of heavy objects, as if something has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That’1l be the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shabby. Greasy. Empty. The trio slide into a booth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you reckon everyone’s alright at the wedding? Maybe we should --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: They were after you, mate. We'd just put everyone in danger going back.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron's right. Cappuccino, please. A gum-chewing WAITRESS stands behind Harry. Ron, clueless when it comes to cappuccinos, nods to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What she said.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Same. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 39

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Wicked scar.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (as she exits) So where do we go from here? The Leaky Cauldron?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Too dangerous. If Voldemort’s taken over the Ministry, none of the old places are safe. The front door SQUEALS and TWO WORKMEN enter, glance idly at the trio and step to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My rucksack. With all my things. I left it back at the Burrow -- Hermione is shaking her head. Harry eyes the beaded purse.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I've had the essentials packed for days. Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: By the way -- these jeans? Not my favorite. Bit tight. Hermione gives him a withering glance. Harry can’t help but smile. Then his eyes shift to the SMALL SECURITY MIRROR near the ceiling, see the two workmen turning.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: The tile EXPLODES on the wall where Ron's head had been only seconds before. A rope of green light singes Hermione’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Stupefy! The JET of RED LIGHT hits the biggest Death Eater straight in the face and he crumples instantly.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH EATER
dialogues.text: Expulsio! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 40

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The table behind Harry explodes and the spell ricochets, shattering the security mirror -- sending shards raining everywhere, including one that laces Hermione’s cheek -- then striking the cappuccino machine, which sprays hot liquid all over the Death Eater. He BELLOWS in pain and Hermione and Ron hit him with TWIN STUNNING SPELLS. As he spasms on the ground, Hermione adds another for good measure:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Petrificus Totalus! He goes still. The Waitress steps from the backroom. Sees the trio. The wands. Her gum bubble... POPS.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Go. She doesn’t argue.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lock the door, get the lights. Hermione throws the bolt. Ron clicks the Deluminator, pitching the cafe into shadow. Harry eyes the unconscious Death Eater.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This one’s name is Rowle. He was on the Astronomy Tower the night Snape killed Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: This is Dolohov. I recognize him from the wanted posters. Ron rolls him over with his foot. Dolohov’s eyes shift in fear from Harry to Hermione, then back to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So what do we do with you, huh? Kill us if it was turned round, wouldn’t you? Ron's face is hard. Hermione eyes him uneasily. He notices.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Suppose it’s him that did Mad-Eye. How would you feel then? Hermione looks at Dolohov. The moment hangs, then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 44 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 41

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's better we wipe their memories. We kill them, they’1l know we were here.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You’re the boss. (turning to Hermione) Hermione? She turns, looks at him. He reaches out, wipes a trickle of blood from her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're the best with spells. Shakily, she points her wand at Dolohov. Her arm trembles.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Obliviate. There is a FLASH OF LIGHT and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio move quickly, glancing about, paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How is it they knew we were there?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Maybe you still have the Trace on you.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Can’t be. The Trace breaks at seventeen. It’s Wizarding law. Hermione stops. Harry and Ron turn, look back.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We didn’t celebrate your birthday, Harry. Ginny and I -- we'd prepared a cake. We were going to bring it out at the end of the wedding... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 45 46 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 42

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione. I appreciate the thought -- honestly. But given that we were almost killed by a couple of Death Eaters a few minutes ago...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Right. Perspective.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We've got to get off the streets, get somewhere safe.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 12 GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: A DOOR marked by the number 12. Harry TAPS his wand on the weathered surface and a series of METALLIC CLICKS are heard. The door swings open with a CREAK.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The GAS LAMPS spring to life, illuminating a narrow cobwebbed hallway. The trio glance about, then Harry takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: MAD-EYE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Severus Snape?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mad-Eye...? Just then a great RUSH OF COLD AIR sweeps through the hallway and the trio’s tongues curl back in their mouths. Some THING shifts in the shadows at the end of the hall, rising from the carpet -- tall, dust-colored and terrible looking -- then rushes toward them. It’s Dumbledore, but a ghostly, worm-eaten Dumbledore, a corpse come to life, with empty eye sockets and sunken face. It raises its wand and then... EXPLODES in a great cloud of dust, swirling like mist in the corridor, drifting back to the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What was that about? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 47 48 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 43

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Mad-eye’s doing, I'd guess. In case Snape decided to come snooping. Just then, a FLOORBOARD CREAKS. The trio stiffen. Slowly, Hermione draws her wand, peers into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Homenum revelio. Nothing. Hermione lowers her wand. Explains.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s a spell to reveal human presence. She extends her hand, watches the settling dust stream through her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view expands and a SMALL VILLAGE is revealed, swathed in mist. This has the feel of a POV. The IMAGE JUMPS and... INT. VILLAGE STREET —- DAWN 48 «+. the POV is MOVING now, THROUGH streets teeming with cloaked figures. The TONGUE that is spoken here is foreign, Germanic. We TURN DOWN an alleyway and the path narrows, the shadows growing more dense. Scratched into a wall is the SYMBOL Xenophilius Lovegood wore around his neck, but the POV LINGERS upon it only briefly. A SIGN comes INTO VIEW, hanging outside a small shop at the very end of a dark cul de sac: “GREGOROVITCH, WANDMAKER.” We CLOSE QUICKLY ON the shop’s door, catch a glimpse of VOLDEMORT’S REFLECTION IN THE GLASS, when...  49 50 51 52 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Harry awakens, peering at the cobwebbed chandelier overhead. He sits up, looks at Hermione, asleep upon the sofa, her arm dangling down to where Ron lies upon the floor, her fingers only inches from his. Nearby, the RADIO HISSES SOFTLY, distant VOICES struggling to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lumos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's wand BLOOMS in the darkness as he scales the stairs and reaches the landing. He peers into a bedroom. The drawers have been turned out. The bedsheets stripped. He moves on, painting the wall with wandlight, illuminating an EMPTY PORTRAIT of a MUDDY LANDSCAPE. He studies it -- long enough that we’ll remember it -- then a FLOORBOARD SQUEAKS -- like the night before. Harry wheels, points his wand down the dark corridor adjacent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves down the narrow corridor to its end, to a DOORWAY. He eyes the nameplate: “SIRIUS.” INT. SIRIUS’ ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION 52 We watch Harry enter from an UNSETTLINGLY LOW POV (Kreacher’s). This room, like the others, has been ransacked. Harry lingers by a PHOTOGRAPH. In it, FOUR

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG HOGWARTS STUDENTS
dialogues.text: PETER PETTIGREW and Lupin -- stand GRINNING before the WHOMPING WILLOW. Harry traces the thin cone of light of his wand across their faces. Books and papers carpet the floor. A WOMAN’S FACE, striking and wise, peers out from a dust jacket. Harry crouches, turns the book over to read its TITLE: A History of Magic by Bathilda Bagshot. Harry turns it BACK over, studies the woman's face again. He begins to rise when he notices a CRUMPLED PIECE OF PAPER embossed at the top with a name: Lily Potter. As Harry begins to read, we hear HER VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: LETTER, (LILY)
dialogues.text: Dear Sirius. Thank you for Harry’s birthday present. You’d think he’d been born on a broom. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 53 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 45

dialogues.speaker: LETTER, (LILY)
dialogues.text: James says he’s got the look of a Seeker, but then James would. We had a very quiet birthday tea, just us and old Bathilda, who dotes on Harry. Wormy dropped by late in the day, but seemed down and didn’t stay long. James is frustrated being shut up here, but Dumbledore’s still got his Invisibility Cloak, so he doesn’t have much choice. By the way, Bathilda tells the most amazing stories about our old Headmaster. I don’t know how much to believe. Can it really be true that Dumbledore -- Harry turns the letter over, but there is no more.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps out, finds Hermione dashing up the stairs. Seeing him, she exhales in relief. CALLS OUT:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! I’ve found him!

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good! Tell him from me he’s a git!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, you can’t just disappear. We thought -- She stops as Harry hands her the letter. She reads.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s from your Mum. To Sirius. Bathilda Bagshot...?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. They knew her. She wrote A History of Magic, you know.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (with irony) Did she now? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 55 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 46

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m thinking maybe we should go talk to her. She still lives in Godric’s Hollow. I’m thinking maybe she could help us. Hermione looks up, regards Harry closely.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. I can imagine why you'd want to go there, but... I don’t think Bathilda Bagshot is going to know where Voldemort hid his Horcruxes. Harry starts to respond, frowns. Hermione reaches out, touches his face lightly.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! I think you two better come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron peers out a curtain as Hermione and Harry join him. In the courtyard outside, TWO DARK figures stand near a tree. ANOTHER sits on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: The two clinging to the tree are Death Eaters for sure. Dunno ‘bout the bloke on the bench. (dropping the curtain) Can’t see us, of course. But we'll have to be careful coming and going. C’mon. There’s something else you need to see. INT. CORRIDOR/REGULUS’ ROOM - MORNING (MOMENTS LATER) 55 Harry and Hermione trail Ron to a narrow doorway. Beyond is a cramped bedroom, walls covered with EERIE scrawlings and symbols of Dark Magic.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Lovely. Ron pulls the door shut. Affixed to the outside is a SMALL SIGN, hand-lettered in a spidery crawl: Do Not Enter (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 56 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 47

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Without the Express Permission of Regulus Arcturus Black

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Regulus Arcturus Black...? Hermione GASPS. Ron nods, extends his hand and taps the first letter of each name on the sign.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: R... A... Be

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: To the Dark Lord. I know I will be dead long before you read this... I have stolen the real Horcrux and intend to destroy it...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: R.A.B. was Sirius’ brother? We see the trio from the strange LOW POV again, sitting round the kitchen table. SLOPPY STACKS of OLD DAILY PROPHETS surround them.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. Question is, did he actually destroy the real Horcrux? Harry nods... then spots a SHADOW trembling on the wall just outside the kitchen. He scrambles up and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop! I order you! Seconds later, Harry reappears... dragging KREACHER the house-elf by one ear. Kreacher MUMBLES FOUL OATHS.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Kreacher...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Been spying on us, have you? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 4

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
