dialogues.text: Kreacher has been... watching. Kreacher always watches.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Maybe he knows. Harry glances at her, realizes what she means, takes the locket and dangles it before Kreacher’s massive eyes like a hypnotist. Kreacher watches it sway back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ever seen this before? Kreacher GRUMBLES incoherently.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Kreacher, I own this place. Sirius left it to me. Which means I own you too. Kreacher grimaces mightily, then gives in.

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: That was Master Regulus’ locket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's right. But there were two, weren’t there? Kreacher’s eyes widen in surprise. He nods again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where’s the other one?

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Kreacher doesn’t know where the other locket is.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But was it here? Did you ever see it? Kreacher spins, his face ugly and vicious:

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Filthy Mudblood -- The Death Eaters will soon be coming for you! Ron snatches Kreacher by the neck, shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: (gargling the words) Blood-traitor Weasley -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 57 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 49

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! RON! Reluctantly, Ron releases the elf.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Answer her.

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Yes. It was here, in this house. A most evil object...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Before he died, Master Regulus ordered Kreacher to destroy it. It was the last thing he asked of Kreacher. But no matter how Kreacher tried, he could not..

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where is it now? Did someone take it, Kreacher?

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: (nodding) He came in the night. He took many things, including the locket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who, Kreacher? Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Mundungus. Mundungus Fletcher. The trio glance at one another, then Harry turns back to Kreacher, looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Find him. Crack! -- Kreacher VANISHES. BEGIN MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIUS THICKNESSE, the new Minister For Magic, stands just where his predecessor did, addressing his EMPLOYEES. In the b.g. we see Yaxley again and DOLORES UMBRIDGE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 49

dialogues.speaker: THICKNESSE
dialogues.text: As your new Minister for Magic, I promise to restore this temple of tolerance to its former glory. Therefore, beginning today, each employee will be required to submit themselves for evaluation. But know this: You have nothing to fear... as long as you have nothing to hide... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 58 59 60 61 62 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 50

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Thicknesse smiles, a GANG of DARK WIZARDS (SNATCHERS) emerge into the atrium, pushing a BLOODIED MAN before them. The crowd STIRS uneasily and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... watch a FLURRY of LEAFLETS flutter from the sky and land in a NEAT pile next to a stack of Daily Prophets. Instantly, the NEWSPAPER BOY begins to insert the leaflets into the paper. Each leaflet is imprinted with HARRY’S FACE and emblazoned with “UNDESIRABLE #1"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOGWARTS EXPRESS stands still upon the cracks as DARK WIZARDS board the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark wizards move down the aisle, flinging open cabin doors, in search of Harry. They pass Ginny and SEAMUS, KATIE BELL, LAVENDER, ROMILDA VANE and CORMAC.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: My father will hear about this. Finally NEVILLE bars their way, smiles defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: He’s not here, you fools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark wizards smash through the front door, enter the parlor. The photographs still sit upon the mantle, showing only Hermione’s parents, the tea they’d been drinking still sitting on the table, dried up, but unwashed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POSTERS of HARRY pattern alley walls and street posts, trembling in a bitter wind. In the shadows, Mundungus Fletcher concludes a transaction with a desperate-looking witch, then begins to count his money with a cruel smile. Seconds later, a Snatcher squad appears and he withdraws into an alley, into the safety of the darkness when suddenly a loud CRACK! is head and... MONTAGE ENDS.  63 64 65 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 51

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 12 GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: DARK FIGURES continue to loom in the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron fiddles with the RADIO, which WHISTLES EERILY as he attempts to find a signal. Harry lies on his side, studying the Snitch in his palm, its wings flapping slowly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: They have flesh memories. Harry turns, sees that Hermione is eyeing the Snitch.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Snitches. They’re never touched by bare skin until the Seeker captures it. Even the wizard who fabricates it wears gloves. That way, if there’s a dispute, the Snitch can identify who first touched it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean... it remembers me?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (nodding) When Scrimgeour first gave it to you, I thought it might open at your touch -- that Dumbledore had hidden something in it. Harry ponders this, eyeing the wings flapping slowly, then... Crack! A SOUND ECHOES down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione race into the kitchen. CRAZY SHADOWS spill from a far door and POTS CRASH. Suddenly, a TINY FIGURE, WET AND RAGGED, tumbles INTO VIEW, bangs into the wall opposite, and scrambles up. As he starts back for the kitchen, he stops. Sees Harry. Smiles. DOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Harry Potter! So long it’s been -- Just then, a HAND -- Kreacher’s -- reaches out, grabs Dobby by the neck and pulls him away.  66 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kreacher, Dobby and Mundungus Fletcher TUMBLE from one side of the kitchen to the other. As they fly apart, Mundungus rolls to his feet, dripping wet, wand flashing.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus! Mundungus’ wand soars into the air... into Hermione’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: As requested, Kreacher has returned with the thief Mundungus Fletcher!

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby has also returned with the thief Mundungus Fletcher!

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: What are you playing at -- setting a pair of bleedin’ ‘ouse-elves on me!

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby was only trying to help! Dobby saw Kreacher in Diagon Alley, which Dobby thought was curious. And then Dobby heard Kreacher mention Harry Potter's name, which Dobby thought was very curious. And then Dobby saw that Kreacher was talking to the thief Mundungus Fletcher, which Dobby thought was very, very --

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: I’m no thief, you foul little git. I’m a purveyer of rare and wondrous objects --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're a thief, Dung. Everyone knows it. Everyone turns. Ron stands in the doorway. Dobby smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Master Weasley! So good to see you again! Ron nods, eyes the BRIGHT RED SHOES on Dobby’s feet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 5

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wicked trainers.

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: Listen, I panicked that night, all right? I never volunteered to die for you, mate. Can I help it if Mad-Eye fell off his broom --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Stop lying! Hermione begins to move toward Mundungus. Ron reaches out, takes her by the shoulders, eyes Mundungus warningly.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Piece of advice. Let’s not rehash old times. Got it... mate?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: When you turned this place over -- don’t deny it! -- you found a locket, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: Why? Was it valuable?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You've still got it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. He’s worried he should have got more money for it.

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t be difficult, would it? Bleedin’ gave it away, din’ I? There I was, pitching me wares in Diagon Alley when some ministry hag comes up and asks to see my license. Says she’s of a mind to lock me up and would’ve, too, she hadn’ taken a fancy to that locket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who was she? This witch?

dialogues.speaker: MUNDUNGUS
dialogues.text: Well, she’s right there, in’t she? Bleedin’ bow an’ all. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 54

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He points to a yellowed Prophet on top of a nearby stack, where a SQUAT WOMAN with the face of a toad blinks from the front page: DOLORES UMBRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty street corner. Then... Ron peers round a building. A few yards off, a WITCH (MAFALDA HOPKIRK) approaches. Ron begins to walk, preceding her down the street, then kneels, fiddling with his shoelace. Zap! The witch stiffens and falls... into the arms of Harry. Ron hurries back, takes her feet and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... helps Harry hustle her OUT OF VIEW. They prop her up between TWO WIZARDS, one tall, one short, both UNCONSCIOUS. Hermione is pouring POLYJUICE POTION into THREE CUPS.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Right. So let’s do it. Who gets who?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, unless one of you fancies wearing a skirt... Hermione leans down, PLUCKS a HAIR from the witch. Ron frowns as he surveys the two remaining wizards.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Remember what we said. Keep your eyes down. Don’t speak to anyone unless absolutely necessary. Act as normal as possible. Just do what you see everyone else doing. We do that -- and with a bit of luck -- we get ourselves inside. And then...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It gets really tricky.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Correct. Harry and Hermione look once more at the STUNNED TRIO before them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is completely mental. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 6

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Completely, utterly, without question.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: The world’s mental. Come on, drink up. We’ve got a Horcrux to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio -- in their new identifies -- emerge. Ron (in the quise of REG CATTERMOLE) takes out an ID CARD.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: In case you’re interested, I’m Reg Cattermole, Magical Maintenance Department.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Mafalda Hopkirk, assistant in the Improper Use of Magic Office. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 71 72 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 55

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: (patting his pockets) I’m nobody.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You’re somebody. Be careful. Just then a SKINNY WIZARD strides by.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY WIZARD
dialogues.text: Morning, Reg! Good luck today.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Oh... yeah. Thanks. Ron glances to Harry and Hermione, jerks his head toward the skinny wizard and they follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the skinny wizard drops down the stairs into a public toilet, the trio appear.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: What do you reckon he meant by ‘Good luck.'? INT. GENTLEMEN’S TOILET - MORNING (SECONDS LATER) 71 Harry and Ron enter, glance around, then, seeing as everyone else is doing so, slip into cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry enters. FLUSHING sounds all around him. He looks to his left, sees a PAIR OF BOOTED FEET climb into the next toilet, then looks to his right, sees Ron -- as Reg Cattermole -- peering in.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: We flush ourselves in?

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Apparently so.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: That's bloody disgusting. As Reg/Ron’s face disappears, Harry steps up onto his toilet, dips his shoe in gingerly, then withdraws it. Completely dry. Stepping in fully, he reaches up, pulls the chain and is instantly sucked down. Seconds later...  73 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +. he comes shooting out of a FIREPLACE into the grand atrium of the Ministry of Magic. He sees Hermione’s already arrived and standing before a MASSIVE STATUE of BLACK STONE depicting a witch and wizard sitting upon hundreds of naked bodies twisted in pain. Harry joins her.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Are those...?

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (nodding; with disgust) Muggles. In their rightful place. Harry glances at the base of the statue, where the words MAGIC IS MIGHT are engraved. Just then, a BALDING WIZARD bumps into Harry.

dialogues.speaker: BALDING WIZARD
dialogues.text: Move it, will you -- oh, Runcorn! Forgive me... The Balding Wizard hurries away, clearly frightened, as does ANOTHER WIZARD, merely at the sight of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You appear to be quite popular. Ron approaches, running a gauntlet of pitying looks from co-workers who echo the Skinny Wizard's “Good Luck.”

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, I'm starting to freak out a bit. Just then, a gang of YOUNG, ROUGH-LOOKING WIZARDS, led by their leader, SCABIOR, enter the Atrium, pushing along a small group of CAPTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: The Ministry must be hiring young these days.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: They're not Ministry. They’re Snatchers. They hunt Muggle-borns and blood-traitors for a price.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: How long did you say this batch of Polyjuice Potion would last, Hermione? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 5

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: Cattlemole! They all jump. Yaxley strides directly up to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: It’s still raining in my office. Two days now.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Really? Have you tried an umbrella? Yaxley eyes Ron curiously, then leans forward menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: You do realize I'm on my way downstairs, don’t you, Cattermole?

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Downstairs...?

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: To interrogate your wife! If my wife’s blood status were in doubt and the Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement needed a job doing, I think I’d make it a priority. You’ve got one hour. Just then, the LIFT behind them clangs open. Hermione tugs Ron inside. Yaxley turns and storms off just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Oh my god. What am I going to do? My wife’s all alone downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron. You don’t have a wife.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, we'll go with you -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 5

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: No, that’s mad. You two find Umbridge. I’1l be fine. But how do I stop it raining?

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Try Finite Incantatem. Of course if something’s gone wrong with an Atmospheric Charm --

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Level Two. Department of Magical Law Enforcement, including Wizengamot Administration Services, Auror Headquarters and Improper Use of Magic Department.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: This is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift opens and Ron begins to back out.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Finite Incantatem, okay. And if that doesn’t work...? But before she can respond the golden grilles of the lift close and she and Harry are swept away.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t like him being on his own down there.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron’s been coming here since he was two years old. It’s us you should be worrying about.

dialogues.speaker: MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You really have horrible teeth, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Level One. Minister of Magic and Support Staff... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 77 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 59

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: (whispering quickly) I say if we don’t locate Umbridge within the hour, we go find Ron and come back another day. Deal? The grilles clang open again and Harry and Hermione freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing next to a LONG-HAIRED WIZARD, her neck enwrapped in a fuzzy PINK SCARF, is DOLORES UMBRIDGE. She looks up from the clipboard in her hand and sees Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Ah, Mafalda! Travers sent you, did he? Good. We'll go straight down. (eying Harry) Albert, aren't you getting out? Harry nods mutely, steps out. As the lift descends, he watches Hermione’s anxious face sink out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Harry passes one gleaming door after anther, glancing down purple-carpeted corridors that stretch into nothingness. A MUTTERING WIZARD passes by, murmuring to a QUILL floating in front of him. Otherwise, it is eerily quiet.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WIZARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Weasley! Harry stops dead, peers around a corner and sees a slight, familiar-looking RED-HEADED WIZARD: PERCY WEASLEY.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WIZARD
dialogues.text: They’re waiting for your report downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, yes... of course. Harry watches Percy hurry off.  78 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves on. Hears VOICES ahead. Emerges into a wide open space and discovers dozens of witches and wizards sitting at a sea of small desks. Waving their wands in unison, squares of PINK PAPER flit like kites through the air, dropping into neat stacks. Harry creeps closer, sees that they are pamphlets entitled, “MUDBLOODS and the Dangers They Pose to a Peaceful Pure-Blood Society.”

dialogues.speaker: RED-HAIRED WITCH
dialogues.text: Reckon the old hag will be interrogating Mudbloods all day?

dialogues.speaker: BESPECTACLED WIZARD
dialogues.text: Sh...careful. Pius Thicknesse appears, trailing a retinue of lackeys.

dialogues.speaker: THICKNESSE
dialogues.text: Runcorn. Harry returns Thicknesse’s nod, watches him pass FROM VIEW. As his gaze shifts, he finds the Red-Haired Witch regarding him with fear. She looks quickly away, resumes her work at double-time. Harry’s eyes shift again, regard a SHINING MAHOGANY DOOR across the way. He squints: something is imbedded within the door. He crosses the room, stops dead. Fitted into the wood is an EYE. It spins weakly, then stops: Mad-Eye’s eye. He looks down to the BRASS NAMEPLATE next to the door:

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF THE MUGGLE-BORN REGISTRATION COMMISSION
dialogues.text: Harry's jaw tightens in anger and he glances over his shoulder, sees the Red-Haired Witch watching him. She glances away quickly. Harry reaches into an inner pocket and removes a DECOY DETONATOR, an odd object with little weaving legs and a rubber-bulbed horn for a body. He releases it. It scuttles down his body, across the floor and directly into the sea of desks. Harry waits. Then... Bang! Black smoke billows into the air, pink pages fly everywhere and the Detonator gives birth to dozens of tiny replicants of itself, which race about the floor, up the legs and across the desks of the pamphleteers. The Red-Haired Witch SHRIEKS. Others follow and Harry...  79 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 60 INT. UMBRIDGE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS ACTION - MORNING 79 +. Slips into Umbridge’s office, closes the door. The room's decor is sickeningly cute. Lace doilies. Dried flowers. Harry takes out his wand.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Accio locket. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 81 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 61

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nothing. Harry frowns, glances about. A LEAFLET bearing his face -- “Undesirable #1” -- lies upon Umbridge’s desk, along with PHOTOGRAPHS of other Order members. Two have a LARGE PINK “X"” scratched on them: Dumbledore and Mad-Eye. Harry begins to search the office, opening drawers, riffling through filing cabinets... then stops. Pulls out a file. Inside is a PHOTOGRAPH of Hermione and an accompanying DATA SHEET: “Blood Status: MUGGLE BORN” “Whereabouts: Last seen in the company of Undesirable #1." Quickly Harry replaces the file and searches out Ron’s. “Blood Status: PURE BLOOD... Pro-Muggle leanings.” “Whereabouts: Last seen in the company of Undesirable #1.” Harry starts to put the file away, then pauses, looks closer. “Father: Arthur Weasley. Ministry Employee. Status: TRACKED. Strong likelihood Undesirable #1 will contact.” Harry stares at the word “TRACKED.” Then:

dialogues.speaker: BALDING WIZARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Let’s calm down, shall we? Harry replaces the file, steps to the door and peers through. Slowly, he eases open the door, back out and...

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: ... turns. The Red-Haired Witch is watching him. He puts his finger to his lips. Her eyes go wide as saucers.

dialogues.speaker: BALDING WIZARD
dialogues.text: It probably just snuck up here from Experimental Charms. I think none of us will soon forget last month’s Poisonous Duck... Seeing the Red-Haired Witch’s expression, the Balding Wizard turns and, as before, withers at the sight of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: BALDING WIZARD
dialogues.text: R-Runcorn. Harry gives him an appraising look, turns the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and dashes off.  82 83 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sprints INTO VIEW just as the same MUTTERING WIZARD trails his QUILL out of an empty lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry races inside, hits a button and watches the grilles close. He glances at his reflection in the mirrored wall. Bares his teeth. Hermione’s right. They’re awful. Just then, the grilles clang open and Ron enters, soaking wet and wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: M-morning.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Harry! Blimey, I forgot what you looked like. Where’s Hermione?

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: She went down to the courtrooms with Umbridge -- The grilles open again and reveal... Arthur Weasley, in the company of an elderly witch (WAKINDA).

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I understand, Wakinda, but I can’t be a party to that. Arthur stops then, seeing Harry, and regards him with utter disdain, then turns his eyes to Ron and softens.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Reg. Isn’t Mary in for questioning today? Try to have faith. If there’s anything Molly and I can do for you -- Arthur pats Ron’s shoulder, stops. Pulls his dripping hand away.

dialogues.speaker: WAKINDA
dialogues.text: Let me guess. It’s raining in Yaxley’s office again?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Tell him to try an umbrella. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 84 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 63

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Arthur and Wakinda exit. As they go, Ron cranes his neck, watching with a look of longing as the grilles begin to close. Suddenly, Harry reaches out, blocks the doors.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: Arthur! You know you’re being tracked, don’t you? Arthur turns.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Is that a threat, Runcorn?

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: No, Arthur. It’s a fact. They’re watching you. Arthur eyes Harry with a mixture of suspicion and confusion and perhaps... recognition. Harry removes his hand. The grilles close. Ron stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you later. Let’s find Hermione. INT. PASSAGEWAY —- MORNING (MOMENTS LATER) 84 Harry and Ron move down a dark torch-lit stone passageway. As they move further along, their BREATH becomes VISIBLE and Ron, soaked to the bones, begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Bloody cold down here. Then they see. Swirling outside the courtroom doors like sentinels are tall black-hooded figures. DEMENTORS. Just then, a man comes stumbling out of the courtroom in the company of a PAIR of DEATH EATERS.

dialogues.speaker: SCARED MAN
dialogues.text: I’m half-blood, I tell you! My father was a wizard! Look him up! William Alderton! He worked here for thirty years... As Ron watches the terrified man pass, Harry grabs his arm, pulls him toward the courtroom.  85 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 64 INT. COURTROOM - SAME TIME —- MORNING 85 A dark cathedral, possessed of a palpable chill. Dementors float eerily in the gloom. The ceiling stretches high, disappears in darkness. As Harry and Ron enter -- unnoticed at first -- they move cautiously, taking in their surroundings. Hermione comes INTO VIEW, sitting with a STACK of PARCHMENT behind a balustrade alongside Umbridge and Yaxley, while a BRIGHT-SILVER CAT -- Umbridge’s Patronus -- prowls up and down, providing warmth to them and them only. Harry's eyes track the cat, then drift to Umbridge herself. Suddenly he falters. Ron notices. Eyes him curiously. WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: What is it? The corners of Harry’s eyes contract, his head slightly cocked... as if he can sense the presence of something.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s here... As Ron reacts -- deciphering Harry’s words -- a WOMAN’S VOICE comes their way:

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: Reg... Ron turns. Below the balustrade, a frail woman, MARY CATTERMOLE, sits alone, wrists chained. Seeing Ron, her wan face brightens. Ron glances at Harry, who nods, urging him on. Ron moves to the center of the room, taking his place behind the woman. Hesitating, he places his hands gently upon her shoulders, then glances up, sees Hermione watching him.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Mary Elizabeth Cattermole?

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Mother to Maisie, Ellie and Alfred? Wife to Reginald? Mary looks up to Ron, her eyes glistening with fear. He smiles reassuringly. She looks away, replies:

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 64

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry eyes Umbridge. She has draped the pink scarf over her chair, revealing a GOLD CHAIN that extends from her neck down into the ruffled folds of her blouse. A slight HUMMING, faint and oddly lyrical, rings in Harry's ears as he studies the chain. As if drawn forward by some irresistible force, he begins to drift toward the balustrade.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: A wand was taken from you upon your arrival at the Ministry today, Mrs. Cattermole. Is this that wand? Umbridge displays a CHERRYWOOD WAND. Mary Cattermole nods.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Would you please tell the court from which witch or wizard you took this wand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 65

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: But I didn’t take it. I got it in Diagon Alley, at Ollivander’s, when I was eleven. It chose me. Umbridge leans forward, teeth glittering as the cat slinks by and briefly illuminates her face -- and the chain at her neck trembles like a snake, something heavy swinging forward and dangling over the void. The LOCKET. Ron stares at it dumbstruck. Hermione catches her breath. Harry, fully removed from the shadow now, stands clearly in view, the corners of his eyes narrowing once again, the HUM growing louder in his ears. Slowly, he reaches into his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: No, no, I don’t think so, Mrs. Cattermole. Wands only choose witches. And you are not a witch.

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: But I am! Tell them, Reg! Tell them what I am! Ron starts to speak, but Umbridge’s gaze has shifted, to Harry, to the wand rising in his hand.. and pointed at her.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: What the devil are you doing, Albert? As Harry speaks, his own face ripples through Runcorn’s, the Polyjuice Potion wearing off.

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY
dialogues.text: You're lying. And one mustn’t tell lies, Dolores... Stupefy! A flash of red light hits Umbridge and she slumps, forehead striking the balustrade. Instantly the silver cat vanishes. Yaxley draws his wand, but Ron is too quick and takes him out with a single blast. Hermione strips the locket from Umbridge’s neck and leaps down. Instantly, her breath comes in plumes as the Dementors drift forward.

dialogues.speaker: EXPETO PATRONUM
dialogues.text: A SILVER STAG soars from the tip of Harry’s wand, circling the room as it drives the Dementors back. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 65

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Relashio! The chains encircling Mary Cattermole’s wrists drop like dead snakes. As she stands, she eyes Harry in amazement as he transforms back into himself. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 66

dialogues.speaker: MARY CATTERMOLE
dialogues.text: You? It’s you! Reg, it’s Harry Potter!

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: ‘Tis, isn’t it? This’1ll be one to tell the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trio, along with Mary Cattermole, pelts into the atrium and races toward the fireplaces, Harry bumps into the muttering wizard, who spins, takes a look at Harry, blinks.

dialogues.speaker: MUTTERING WIZARD
dialogues.text: Harry Potter...? (louder) Harry Potter. Another wizard hears, looks, then repeats the same, Harry's name spreading like wildfire in the gloomy hush. Hermione glances about nervously and as she does, begins to transform back into herself.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry... they’ve seen you. We’ve got to get out of here. Harry nods, quickens his pace. Ron glances about, then turns, facing Mary as he continues to walk backwards.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Mary. Go home. Get the kids. I’ll... I’1l meet you there. We have to get out the country, understand? Mary shakes her head, confused.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: Mary! Do as I say! Mary stops, a bit teary-eyed, nods dutifully. Ron frowns.

dialogues.speaker: REG CATTERMOLE/RON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It’s just -- Mary Cattermole takes him by the collar, pulls him into a deep kiss. Harry and Hermione glance back and watch as Ron transforms -- during the kiss -- back into himself. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 87 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 67

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: All eyes turn. The real Reg Cattermole stands -- robeless -- outside one of the fireplaces. She looks up at Ron, now transformed, and jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Long story. Nice meeting you. He gives her a peck, races off. He’s halfway to the fireplaces when he spies... Percy. He slows, then stops altogether, and they stare, wordless, at one another. Finally, Percy begins to open his mouth --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Piss off. Yaxley staggers into the atrium.

dialogues.speaker: YAXLEY
dialogues.text: Seal the exits! Now! Harry, Ron and Hermione glance at each other, break for the fireplaces. As Yaxley fires on them, one fireplace after another seals itself. As they reach the last open grate, they pitch themselves -- as one -- onto the polished marble floor -- spells sailing over their heads -- and go sliding inside. As they fall into darkness, Harry glances back and watches Yaxley pitch himself into the void just before a solid block of granite drops -- like a guillotine -- sealing the fireplace and plunging Yaxley -- and the trio -- into total darkness. A whirlwind tosses the trio as FLASHES of LIGHT reveal each briefly, including Yaxley, who reaches out for Hermione’s robe. The door of Grimmauld Place rushes forward, the eyes of the SERPENT KNOCKER flashing, then there is a BURST of PURPLE LIGHT, a TORTURED SCREAM and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world spins as Harry lies on his back on a bed of leaves and twigs. Above, sunlight streams through a canopy of trees. Wincing, Harry rises on his elbows, sees the locket lying in the dirt. He scrabbles up, scoops it into his fingers and GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, quickly, in my bag, there’s a small bottle labeled ‘Essence of Dittany.’ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 68

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry turns, sees Hermione, bent over Ron’s twitching body.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Quickly! Harry blinks, stumbles dizzily to the bag. As he reaches in, objects present themselves in furious succession.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Accio Dittany. A small BROWN BOTTLE lands in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Unstopper it. Hermione rips open Ron’s shirt, which is soaked in blood. The flesh of his upper arm is flayed, as if someone had scooped a portion away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione. His arm --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Just do it! Harry does so, hands her the bottle. She sprinkles three drops onto Ron’s BLEEDING WOUND. Greenish SMOKE billows.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What happened? I thought we were going back to Grimmauld Place.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We were. We were there. But Yaxley had hold of me. I knew we couldn’t stay once he’d seen, so when he let go I brought us here. Ron got Splinched. I’m... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t be stupid. The smoke sifts, clears. Ron’s wound no longer bleeds.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s all I feel safe doing. Hermione rises, takes out her wand and begins to walk in a wide circle, MUTTERING.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Salvio Hexia... Protego Totalum... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 88 89 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 69

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Protective enchantments. I don’t fancy another visit like we had on Shaftesbury Avenue, do you? Especially with Ron like this. You can get going on the tent...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tent? Where am I supposed to find -- He stops, glances down at her bag, then back to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Repello Muggletum... Muffliato...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tent glows from within under a starlit sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione pours tea from a kettle into cups.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How’re the mushrooms? Seem to be the only edible things growing round here. Harry grimaces as he chews. “Edible” is clearly debatable.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They’re great.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Make sure to leave some for Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) No problem. Harry sets his plate aside, plucks up the locket, dangles it in the firelight. Glances at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How bad is he? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 7

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He'll be alright in a few days. Hopefully. If we could take him to Hogwarts, to Madam Pomfrey -- Harry's glance stops her, confirming what she knows.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: So where do we go next?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dumbledore had a theory. He felt that the Horcruxes would not be made out of random objects. And he felt they wouldn’t be hidden randomly either. We know of three so far. The ring, which according to Dumbledore belonged to Tom Riddle’s grandfather. The diary, which belonged to Tom himself. And this, which -- again, according to Dumbledore -- belonged to his mother. Hermione eyes the locket as it glimmers in the firelight.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It scares me a bit, that, thinking it’s a piece of Vol--

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, don’t! Don’t say it! Harry and Hermione turn, see Ron stirring.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s taboo -- You-Know-Who’s name. That’s how they track people now. It’s how they found us in the cafe that night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How d’you know?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I overheard a bloke from the Enforcement office talking about it at the Ministry. Blimey, what’s that smell?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (no longer confident) Dinner? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 90 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 71

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Not bloody likely. Smells like something Ginny would cook.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Tea? Ron nods. Grimacing, he pushes himself up, notices he’s wearing a SLING of Hermione’s fashioning. He looks from it to her as she tends the tea, a flicker of remorse playing over his face for his “dinner” remarks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Is that it? Harry nods, hands him the locket. Ron turns it over in his hand. Frowns. Looks at Harry, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know. I felt it too. (off Hermione’s look) It’s... it’s like it’s ticking or something, like it has a tiny metal heart, like it’s --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: ++. alive. Harry nods. Hermione eyes it coldly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I hate it. It’s like he’s here with us.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's why we’re going to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: LYING UPON A TREE STUMP.
dialogues.text: Ron leans against a tree, looking pale. Hermione nods to Harry. He raises his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dissendium! The locket spins swiftly in place, but remains whole.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Incendio! Flames engulf the locket and its metal flesh turns scarlet, but then the flames die. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 7

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expulso! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 91 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 72

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tree stump EXPLODES, but the locket remains unmarked.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Confringo! The ground beneath the stump craters, but the locket remains untouched. Hermione lowers her wand, but Harry continues on, firing a succession of spells, looking almost possessed. Hermione studies him oddly until, finally, he stops. All goes silent except for the leaves shifting in wind above. Then, slowly, another sound comes clear... a TICKING. Coming from the locket.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s angry. Hermione shivers. Harry steps forward, kneels down and takes the locket by its chain. It TICKS. He slings it over his neck. Rises.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We have to keep it safe until we can figure out how to destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I can put it in my bag --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Seems strange, mate. Dumbledore sends you off to find a load of Horcruxes, but doesn’t bother to tell you how to destroy them. Doesn’t that bother you? Harry studies the locket, whose TICKING has slowed, then walks off. Hermione eyes Ron, who returns her glance, then pushes away from the tree and walks off slowly in the opposite direction. INT. TENT —- DUSK 91 Ron lies on his cot, fiddling with the radio. VOICES surface in the STATIC briefly, then fade.  92 93 94 95 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 73 EXT. ENCAMPMENT —- SAME TIME - DUSK 92 Harry turns the MIRROR SHARD over in his fingers, then eyes Hermione collecting flowers in the distance. She looks beautiful. Seeing him, she smiles, waves, moves on. The RADIO SPITS STATIC and he TILTS THE MIRROR so he can see Ron. He looks annoyed, but holds his tongue and slips the mirror in his pocket. Noticing the locket, he slips it from his shirt, studies the fissures in the locket’s metal skin. Suddenly he WINCES. The locket spills from his palm, dances upon the chain. The SKIN encircling his scar CONSTRICTS.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tell me, Gregorovitch. Tell me where it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD MAN (GREGOROVITCH) with pure-white hair and a bushy beard cowers in a dark corner.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOROVITCH
dialogues.text: I told you! I no longer have it! It was stolen from me! Many years ago!

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t be lying to me, would you, Gregorovitch? Because, I must tell you... that will only Make it worse for you... As a bony hand -- Voldemort’s -- extends a wand, Gregorovitch reacts with fear and we RUSH IN, DRIFTING THROUGH his dilating pupil INTO...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: «+. a hall of shadows. A younger Gregorovitch hurries toward a distant room, a lantern bobbing in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOROVITCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I speak the truth! I remember like it was yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregorovitch bursts inside, lantern swaying. Wood shavings litter the floor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 74

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the window ledge, perched like a giant bird, a YOUNG MAN (GRINDEWALD) with golden hair grins devilishly, then raises his WAND. A BLAST of LIGHT bleaches the screen and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregorovitch’s face stricken with terror, as Voldemort’s want tip blazes with light.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Who was he? The thief?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOROVITCH
dialogues.text: Just a boy! Not of the village. It was he who took it. I never saw it again. I swear on my life.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: I believe you... A BURST OF GREEN LIGHT engulfs the room and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's eyes flutter open. He sees Hermione, beautiful in the amber dusk, standing a bit away, studying him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I thought it had stopped. Harry looks at her, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You can’t let him in, Harry. Dumbledore himself said it. You have to close your mind. It’s too dangerous --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s not a candle I can blow out, Hermione. It always burns, even if it’s just a flicker. Can you understand that? Harry eyes her, then looks away. She frowns, concerned by this, then:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Tell me. What you saw. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 7

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He’s found him. Vol-- He stops, glancing back toward the tent, toward Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You-Know-Who. He’s found Gregorovitch --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The wandmaker?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes. How’d you know?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Viktor got his wand from Gregorovitch. Most Durmstrang students did at one time. What’s he got to do with You-Know-Who? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 75

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You-Know-Who wants something Gregorovitch once had -- dunno what. But he’s desperate to have it. It’s as if his life depends on it. Hermione studies Harry. The RADIO SQUAWKS from inside the tent. Harry’s eyes flare; he starts to speak --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t -- It... comforts him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well it sets my teeth on edge. What’s he expecting to hear? Good news?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I think he just hopes he doesn’t hear bad news. It gets him through the day.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And what gets you through the day?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We've all made sacrifices, Harry. Harry eyes her expressionlessly, nods toward the tent.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How long before he can travel?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It takes time. I’m doing all I can.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You’re not doing enough. Hermione studies Harry’s angry profile. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Take it off. Harry turns, sees Hermione studying him closely. She points toward his throat, toward the locket.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Take it off. Now. Harry slips the locket off... REACTS. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 98 99 100 101 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 76

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Better?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Loads. Hermione takes the locket, cradles it in her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s cold. Even though it’s been lying against your skin for days. Hermione sees Harry studying the locket, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We'll take turns. Okay? Hermione slips it over her neck. She frowns briefly, sensing its presence, then looks up at Harry. He studies her, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sleeps beside the CRACKLING radio. Harry lies a few feet away, awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione huddles outside in the frigid darkness, trembling. Her eyes rake the trees. Deep within, there is, for the briefest of instances... movement. Or so it seems. She squints. Sees nothing. Returns her chin to her chest. As she does, something carries on the air... laughter. The cackle of... boys? Or so it seems. Her chin rises. She looks again into the trees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry reaches out, starts to turn the radio off when:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-. Severus Snape, newly appointed Headmaster of Hogwarts... As the signal fades, Harry rolls onto his side and twists the dial. Behind him, we see Hermione’s shadow RISE, move away from the tent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione moves toward the trees...  102 103 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the radio resists him, fading in and out, Harry grabs his rucksack, pulls out the WRINKLED MARAUDER’S MAP.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... bears little resemblance to the school under Dumbledore’s leadership. Snape’s curriculum is severe, reflecting the wishes of the Dark Lord and infractions are dealt with harshly by the two Death Eaters on the staff... Harry peers at the map before him and -- sure enough -- discovers Snape’s name drifting about Dumbledore’s office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione moves deeper into the trees, then stops. SHADOWS splinter amid the towering trunks and VOICES come clearer. Standing utterly still, Hermione watches as a GANG of SNATCHERS make their way in her direction. They look unwashed and feral, as if they’ve been in the wild for some time. As they pass, within feet of her, but unable to see her, only Hermione’s eyes track their passage. As before Scabior leads the way, FENRIR GREYBACK at his side. Abruptly, Scabior stops, eyes narrowing.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: What’s that? That... smell? The others glance about dumbly. Scabior retraces his steps until he stands directly in front of Hermione, his eyes looking right through her. He leans forward ever-so- slightly, only inches from her neck, NOSTRILS FLARING. The locket TICKS, trembling upon Hermione’s breastbone. Then, slowly, Scabior pulls back, eyes probing the darkness, before withdrawing, leading the others away. The last pair drag what appear to be BODIES. As they vanish within the trees, Hermione finally swallows.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Snatchers. She spins, finds Harry standing a few feet off.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good to know your enchantments work. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 105B
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 78

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He could smell it. My perfume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pushes past the tent flap, peers into the darkness. In the distance, he sees Harry and Hermione. Standing close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione hugs herself. Shivers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We have to leave. We’re not safe here.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I told you. Ron’s not strong enough to Apparate.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then we’ll go by foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN DOWN FROM the sky, FIND the HORIZON. THREE FIGURES approach in the distance. Harry. Hermione. Ron. We HOLD. Then, faintly, so faint it can barely be heard at first, a SOFT WHISTLING SOUND rises on the breeze. We PAN BACK UP. Slowly, one by one, DOTS perforate the blue. The WHISTLING SOUND BUILDS. Harry stops, listening, then turns. Hermione trailing a few feet behind, stops, eyeing him questioningly. We RACK FOCUS, OVER her shoulder, watch the DOTS attenuate, take the shape of PLUMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHISTLING is EAR-SPLITTING now, more of a ROAR, as the trio scarper into a listing barn and throw shut the doors. As they peer upward through the skeletal remains of the hayloft, their faces lashed with LIGHT, they see a succession of DEATH EATERS strafe the blue above. The rotting timber buzzes and BATS dance crazily in the loft above. Gradually, the sound recedes. The bats settle.  106 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An epic flyover. Three small figures move slowly below. One figure -- Ron -- trails the other two: Harry and Hermione. We CUT DOWN TO ground level. TO Ron. He glances about sullenly, staring at the forsaken landscape, then looks up ahead to Harry and Hermione. The sight of them, walking side-by-side, does nothing to improve his mood.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m hungry. Harry and Hermione stop, turn. Study him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m hungry. Hermione glances at Harry, who continues to stare at Ron, as if taking the measure of him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We’re all hungry. Ron returns Harry’s glance, then looks off again. Hermione crosses to Ron, examines his RAGGED BANDAGE.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Leave it. Hermione glances at Ron’s profile, then -- briefly -- at the Horcrux dangling from his neck. Ignoring his words, she begins to rummage in her beaded bag.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Mum can make food appear out of thin air.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (tenderly) No one can conjure food out of thin air. Food is the first of the five Principal Exceptions to Gamp’s Law. The other four are --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (sharply) Oh, speak English, can’t you? As Ron jerks his injured arm away, Hermione looks up, meets Ron’s hard gaze. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 78

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I said leave it. Hermione glances at the bandage in her hand, puts it away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’ll be dark soon. We need to find a place to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Good plan.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Brilliant. Only, correct me if I’m wrong... wasn’t that yesterday’s plan? And the day before that? And the day before that? Walk. Sleep. Walk. Sleep. Harry stares at Ron, then begins to walk toward him. Hermione watches silently. Ron stands utterly still. When Harry stops, he simply nods to Ron’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My turn. As he reaches out, Ron blocks his hand. For a moment, they simply stand silently. Then Ron strips the chain from his neck, hands it to Harry and brushes past him. Harry glances at Hermione, drapes the Horcrux over his head and follows. Hermione watches them go, then does the same.  107

dialogues.speaker: 107B
dialogues.text: 108 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light RAIN falls. Harry, wearing the locket now, walks the perimeter of the camp. He glowers toward the tent in the distance. In the tent, safe, warm and out of earshot, Hermione tends to Ron’s arm as he stares at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know what he’s doing, does he? A frown creases Hermione’s forehead as she studies Ron, then she glances at Harry, a trace of doubt in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: None of us do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three figures move through a blood-red autumnal landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charred husks of several RVs -- hulking black masses -- lay about the ash-ridden park. Ron, trailed by Harry and Hermione, pauses. His eyes scan the scorched earth, fix on a BLACKENED SWING, swaying back and forth in a tiny playground. His eyes shift to the ground and he crouches. His fingers shift the dry dirt, reveal a SHINY TOY not of Muggle making.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wizards were here.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t like this place. Harry and Ron both turn, look at her.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RON’S FACE FILLS THE SCREEN -- unwashed and wild. He looks toward something UNSEEN. Then... «+. a RABBIT hops INTO VIEW, nose probing some brush. Slowly, Ron raises his wand, poised to fire when... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 109 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 79

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BAM! Dirt explodes near the rabbit’s rump and it is off and running. Seconds later, Harry appears, giving chase. Ron curses and pelts after. The rabbit zig-zags through the trees, eluding one blast after another as Harry and Ron trip through the forest. They begin laughing, their aim becoming more and more erratic. A tree limb explodes over Harry’s head and he wheels, fires playfully back at Ron. They exchange a few more blasts when one narrowly misses Harry. Instinctively, eyes flaring, he wheels, fires back at Ron, narrowly missing him. They both stop, stare at one another, chests heaving, their breath drifting in plumes, smiles gone. Ron rubs his injured arm, almost healed now, and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: «+. OF MUSHROOMS. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 80

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the shadows, Ron lies on his back, staring gloomily at the pitched ceiling of the tent, listening to the RADIO’S MURMUR, while Hermione, WEARING A RED SCARF AGAINST THE CHILL, runs the fingers of her left hand through Harry's hair, alternately employing the wand in her right hand to trim Harry's hair and flip the pages of A History of Magic.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I‘11 tell you in a minute. Harry watches his hair dropping to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe you could tell me now.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Alright. The Sword of Gryffindor? It’s Goblin made.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. Dirt and rust have no effect on the blade. It only takes in that which makes it stronger.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: O-kay.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. You already destroyed one Horcrux, right? Tom Riddle’s diary -- in the Chamber of Secrets.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: With a basilisk fang. If you tell me you’ve got one of those in that bloody beaded bag of yours --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t you see! In the Chamber of Secrets, you stabbed the basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Its blade is impregnated with basilisk venom.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It only takes in that which makes it stronger...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Exactly! Which means...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: .». it can destroy Horcruxes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Which is why Dumbledore left it to you in his will.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You're brilliant, Hermione. Truly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Actually, I’m highly logical, which allows me to look past the extraneous detail and perceive clearly that which others overlook.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There’s only one problem... Suddenly the LIGHTS CLICK OFF...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: The sword was stolen. The lights click back ON. Hermione and Harry turn, see Ron, Deluminator in hand, lying in the shadows of his bunk, staring at the roof as the FIRST DROPS OF RAIN hit the canvas above.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m still here. But you two carry on. Don’t let me spoil your fun. Harry glances at Hermione, who is studying Ron warily.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Problem? There’s no problem. Not according to you, anyway. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 81

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heavy DROPS of rain begin to PELT the canvas of the tent. Plunk. Plunk. Plunk.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, don’t be shy. If you’ve got something to say, spit it out. Ron swings out of the bunk. As his face meets the light, he looks mean, the locket chain glittering. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 82

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: All right, I'll spit it out. Don’t expect me to skip up and down because now there’s some other damn thing we’ve got to find.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Ron...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I thought you knew what you signed up for.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought I did too.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. What part of this isn’t living up to your expectations? Did you think we’d be staying in five-star hotels? Finding a Horcrux every other day? Did you think you'd be back to Mummy by Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, I just reckoned after all this time, we'd have actually achieved something. I reckoned you knew what you were doing. I reckoned Dumbledore had told you something worthwhile! I reckoned you had a plan!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’ve told you everything Dumbledore told me! And in case you haven’t noticed, we’ve found a Horcrux!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we’re about as near getting rid of it as we are to finding the rest of them, aren’t we! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Take it off, Ron. Please take it off. You wouldn’t be talking like this if you hadn’t been wearing it all day --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, he would. D’you think I haven't noticed the two of you whispering behind my back? D’you think I haven’t guessed what you were thinking?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, we weren’t --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Don’t lie! You said it, too, you said you were disappointed --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I didn’t! Not like that! Harry -- I didn’t!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do you know why I listen to that radio, every night? Do you! To make sure I don’t hear Ginny’s name or Fred or George or Mum or --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You think I don’t listen! You think I don’t know what it’s like --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: NO! YOU DON’T KNOW WHAT IT’S

dialogues.speaker: HAVE NO FAMILY
dialogues.text: Dead silence. Harry glares at Ron. Hermione looks shocked. Suddenly, they both rush forward and lock on each other’s throats, Hermione rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! They let go, step back. Harry points to Ron’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go then. But leave that. Hermione, eyes flashing with panic, glances from Harry to Ron. Ron strips the chain from his neck, casts it away, then turns to Hermione. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Are you staying? Or coming? Hermione looks anguished, glancing from one to the other. The canvas streams with rain behind her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 110 111 112 113 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 84

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Fine. I get it. I saw you two the other night. Yeah, that’s right. Didn't know I knew, did you?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What? Ron, no -- please -- He whips aside the tent flap and the RAIN ROARS. As Hermione rushes after him, she tips over the radio. As it HISSES Harry glowers at the Horcrux. Seconds later, Hermione returns, sopping hair plastered to her face.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s gone. EXT. RIVERBANK —- MORNING 110 The river flows quietly, thick and muddy from the previous night’s rain. Harry emerges from the tent, peers into the trees. Hermione stands far down by the riverbank, tying the red scarf to a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione, eyes red from crying, clutches the beaded bag in one hand while the locket dangles from the other. She peers one last time toward the trees, then, without turning, reaches out her hand. Harry studies her, then steps forward, gently takes her fingers in his. Instantly... ... they Disapparate, pitched into a whirlwind of darkness. As they reappear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. on a windswept hillside, their hands break free and Hermione stumbles away, sobs racking her body as she buries her face in her hands. Harry watches her, then turns away, takes out his wand and begins to walk in a circle, casting enchantments in a soft voice.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Salvio Hexia... Protego Totalum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks the perimeter of the camp, looking up every so often to look at the ILLUMINATED TENT. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 114 115 116 117 118 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 85

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He watches HERMIONE’S SHADOW pass within, sliding over the canvas. Seconds later, the RADIO CRACKLES to life. He shakes his head, vaguely annoyed, then starts to move off again when a SONG comes CLEAR. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry ducks into the tent, Hermione looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s a Muggle station. Hermione smiles and Harry does too. Harry listens then, debating, reaches out his hand. Hermione eyes him uncertainly, then allows him to pull her to her feet. He steps forward, gently removes the locket from her neck and tosses it to the ground. She looks at it, then back to him. He smiles and, without prompting... «+. they begin to dance, tentatively at first, then letting themselves go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their shadows flicker upon the canvas like joyous shadow puppets, moving with abandon until, abruptly, the signal slips away and... INT. TENT —- SAME TIME - DUSK 116 «+. the STATIC returns. Their smiles fade. They stop moving. Hermione averts her eyes, exits. Harry watches her go, then takes the locket from the floor, slings it over his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione, wrapped in a blanket, sits just outside the tent by a wind-whipped fire, going back and forth between Tales of Beedle the Bard and another book, Spellman’s Syllabary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lies on the top bunk above Ron’s empty lower, eyeing his face in the surface of the Snitch sitting there. As he takes it in hand, the wings begin to flap slowly up and down. He watches it for a long time... when an idea strikes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 119 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 86

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Folding his fingers around the orb, he brings it to his lips briefly, then turns it over in his palm. The Snitch’s tired wings go still. Then, as if written by an invisible hand, WORDS appear on the smooth golden surface: “I open at the close.”

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry slips through the flap, hands her the Snitch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You were right. It’s like you said. Snitches have flesh memories. But I didn’t catch my first Snitch with my hand. I almost swallowed it. Hermione watches the WORDS VANISH on orb.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: ‘I open at the close?’

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you reckon it means?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But look, I’ve found something as well... She turns The Tales of Beedle the Bard into the flickering light, points to the top of the title page, to a SMALL DRAWING of a TRIANGULAR EYE.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I thought it was a picture of an eye, but now I don’t think it is. It isn’t a rune and it’s not in Spellman’s Syllabary either. And it’s been inked in -- somebody drew it -- it isn’t part of the book.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Luna’s dad was wearing that, at Ron- (catching himself) At Bill and Fleur’s wedding. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 8

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What d’you mean -- wearing it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Around his neck. Like an amulet. I didn’t think much of it at the time. You know Luna -- she’s always got some mad thing or the other she’s carrying around. I just figured it ran in the family.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Why would someone have drawn it in a children’s book? As Hermione shakes her head, musing, Harry eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, I’ve been thinking. I -- I want to go to Godric’s Hollow. It’s where I was born, it’s where my parents died --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And it’s exactly where You-Know- Who will expect you to go. Because it means something to you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But it means something to him too, Hermione. You-Know-Who nearly died there. Wouldn’t that be just the kind of place he’d hide a Horcrux? Hermione eyes him. Despite herself, she knows he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s dangerous, Harry. But I have to admit, recently even I’ve been thinking we might have to go. I think it’s possible something else is hidden there. (off Harry’s look) The sword. If Dumbledore didn’t want it falling into the Ministry’s hands, but wanted you to find it, what better place to hide it than the birthplace of the founder of Gryffindor himself? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 120 121 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 88

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Godric’s Hollow is the birthplace of Godric Gryffindor -- I mean, ‘course it is. Obvious, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (eyeing him knowingly) Harry, did you ever even open A History of Magic?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tossed it at Neville once when he was snoring -- might’ve popped open. She smiles, then rises, collecting her books and blanket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione... Words fail him. Hermione reaches out, lightly strokes his hair as she heads toward the tent.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t ever let me give you a haircut again. EXT. GODRIC’S HOLLOW - NIGHT 120 Golden streetlights glimmer along a narrow road leading to the center of town. Christmas decorations twinkle in the windows of small cottages, roofs blanketed in snow. Hermione and Harry Apparate INTO VIEW, wearing HEAVY COATS and hats, scarves wrapped around their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I still think we should’ve used Polyjuice Potion.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. This is where I was born. I’m not returning as someone else. He holds out his arm and Hermione takes it. They move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione walk, arms linked. A PUB DOOR opens briefly and LAUGHTER and MUSIC spill forth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 122 123 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 89

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, I think it’s Christmas Eve! Listen... Her voice is wistful. As they listen, VOICES carry from the church up ahead. Harry eyes the GRAVEYARD beyond.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you think they’d be in there? My mum and dad?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think they would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SINGING is FULL AND RICH here as Harry and Hermione make their way through the snow toward the graveyard. Harry peers up at the STAINED GLASS windows glittering over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pushes through a gate, then lets go of Hermione’s hand, row upon row of snowy tombstones stretch before him. As he heads off, Hermione studies him, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEYARD
dialogues.text: Hermione pauses by a large tombstone freckled with lichen.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is it -- ?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No. But look. Harry steps over, looks: KENDRA DUMBLEDORE AND HER DAUGHTER ARIANA. A quotation is etched in the granite: “Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.”

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Did you know he had a sister? Harry stares at the stone, his face a mask. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 90

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Harry turns away, walks off.

dialogues.speaker: TOMBSTONES
dialogues.text: Hermione walks amid the stones, studying the names, then stops by an extremely old grave. She crouches.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Lumos. Hermione plays the wand’s light over the surface of the stone, then stops. Though deeply worn by time, the symbol is unmistakable: the TRIANGULAR EYE. Hermione rakes the light over the name: IGNOTUS PEVERELL.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ignotus... Hey, Har -- She stops. Harry stands several rows away. Utterly still.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: As he stares at the tombstones of his parents:

dialogues.speaker: JAMES POTTER LILY POTTER
dialogues.text: Born 27 March 1960 Born 30 January 1960 Died 31 October 1981 Died 31 October 1981 “The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.” Hermione appears, looks at Harry. Sees that tears are streaming down his cheeks. Hermione raises her wand, traces a circle in the air and a WREATH of CHRISTMAS ROSES blossom in the snow. Harry nods, staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Happy Christmas, Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Happy Christmas, Harry. Hermione laces her arm around his waist and he drapes his arm over her shoulder. They stand silently. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 124 125 126 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 91

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Someone's watching us. By the gate. Harry nods, careful not to look too soon, then glances up. A STOOPED FIGURE, barely discernible in the drifting snow, stands in the shadows of the church. She -- it is distinctly female, and older -- doesn’t move initially -- as if wanting Harry to see her -- then turns away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All light has left the sky. The stooped figure hobbles along, past the pub, where shadows play against the windows and muffled voices can be heard. Harry and Hermione follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione eyes the woman ahead, then looks about their surroundings, feeling trapped.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t think this is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We look like ordinary Muggles.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Muggles who've just been laying flowers on your parents’ grave. Just then, up ahead, the stooped woman holds up her hand and Hermione and Harry stop. Seconds later, a group of SNATCHERS passes by the alley. As they vanish, the woman continues on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Relax. This is right. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman hobbles on. The lane is lined with modest cottages with small and tidy gardens. Hermione barely gives them a glance, nervously eyeing the woman ahead, before realizing she is walking alone. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 127 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 92

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns, sees Harry standing several yards back, staring at a dark cottage, its garden overgrown with weeds, its roof entirely covered in ivy and snow. Hermione returns to him, looks. GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Omigod. Harry...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is where they died, Hermione. This is where he murdered them. Hermione studies Harry's bitter profile, then the house, careful not to disturb the moment with words. Absently, Harry places his fingers upon the locket at his chest. It is trembling -- over-so-slightly. Then, without turning, while still staring at the house, Harry speaks:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You're Bathilda, aren’t you? Hermione blinks, confused, then turns and jumps. The old woman is standing only yards away, watching them. INT. BATHILDA BAGSHOT’S HOUSE - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 127 The door rattles open and tiny BATHILDA BAGSHOT hobbles inside, followed first by Harry, then Hermione, who wrinkles her nose. As Bathilda exits the room, Hermione glances about.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, I’m not sure about this.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, she knew Dumbledore. She might have the sword. Besides, she’s barely knee-high to a house-elf. I think we can overpower her if it turns ugly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
