dialogues.text: There’s something odd about her. And what’s that smell?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She’s gaga, remember? Bathilda returns, holding a box of matches. She strikes one, tries to light a candle, but her movements are clumsy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here. Let me do that. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 93

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You have a lovely house, Miss Bagshot. Hermione eyes a PHOTOGRAPH of a CURIOUSLY COMPELLING YOUNG GIRL (ARIANA), then runs a finger along a table. It comes away thick with dust. She frowns, looks up, finds Bathilda watching her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Miss Bagshot? Who is this man? Harry stands by a chest of drawers, holding the match over a grouping of PHOTOGRAPHS. Coated in DUST, the figures in the frames flit like ghosts behind veils. Harry picks one up, wipes away the dust with his hand. In it a merry-faced boy looks out, his cheery expression belying a particularly intense gaze.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: His name. Can you tell me his name? Bathilda stares at the photograph solemnly, then peers up at Harry. Her eyes are THICK with CATARACTS. Harry stares, unnerved, then Hermione walks over, looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is him, Hermione. The one I saw in Gregorovitch’s wandshop. The thief. Miss Bagshot, who is he? She looks at him, then jerks her head toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She wants us to go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: All right... As Hermione moves, Bathilda shakes her head, points at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She wants me to go. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Why? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 129 130 131 132 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 94

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s all right. You stay here.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry... Harry holds up his hand, silencing her, then follows Bathilda. Just before he disappears, he looks back and winks, but Hermione doesn’t look reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry trails Bathilda up a circular staircase, uncomfortably narrow and lined with books.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore. A hand reaches in, takes it. Hermione’s hand. A NOTE is attached: “Dear Batty. Thanks for your help. You said everything... even if you don’t remember. Rita.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry enters a dark low-ceilinged room. He wrinkles his nose at the smell, then hears the door close behind him. The room plunges into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos. Harry sweeps the room, gives a start. Bathilda’s face wavers in the dark, only feet away, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione hugs herself as she exits the sitting room and peers into the adjacent hallway. A sliver of the kitchen can be seen and a faint BUZZING heard. A strange SHADOW dances on one kitchen wall, of SPECKS moving. Hermione approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry watches as Bathilda moves closer, transfixed by her milky eyes. The Horcrux on his chest TWITCHES. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 133 134 135 136 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 95

dialogues.speaker: BATHILDA BAGSHOT
dialogues.text: (in Parseltongue) You are Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (in Parseltongue) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hermione nears the kitchen, she eyes the CLOUD of SPECKS swarming the wall curiously. The BUZZING GROWS to a HISS as the room... comes INTO VIEW. Hermione GASPS. CLOTTED BLOOD streaks the sink and great wide swaths of RED stain the floor where HUNDREDS OF FLIES swarm.

dialogues.speaker: BATHILDA BAGSHOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in Parseltongue) I have something for you... Hermione’s gaze rises, to the ceiling, to the HEATING VENT, from which the hissing voice has just come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry’s arm droops, his wand tip painting the room with dots of light as he sways, wincing as his scar stings. Bathilda points, to a dressing table cluttered with soiled laundry, her milky eyes fixed on Harry. Something surfaces in her filmy corneas, her pupils changing from dots to silts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione, wand drawn, ascends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry peers at the foul laundry, moving closer, when, out of the corner of his eye, Bathilda moves weirdly. He wheels and watches in horror as... Bathilda’s old body collapses and Nagini pours from her neck. As Harry raises his wand, Nagini STRIKES, piercing his forearm. His wand flies out of his hand, its light spinning dizzily around the room. Nagini’s tail swings about, knocks Harry’s legs out from under him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 136 137 138 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 96

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Harry! As Harry rolls onto his back, gasping for breath, Nagini’s massive body rolls over him, the Horcrux ticking feverishly against his chest. As Harry ROARS in pain, the lenses of his GLASSES fracture. The bedroom door swings open, reveals Hermione silhouetted against the stairwell, wand poised. A FLASH OF RED LIGHT ricochets around the room and Nagini’s tail whips angrily about, shattering the bedroom window. Hermione dives aside and Harry covers his face as the curtains burst into flames and shards of glass shower the room in a rush of cold air. As Harry reclaims his wand and rises, Nagini’s body uncoils in fury, splintering furniture and blasting holes into the walls.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Confringo! As Hermione’s spell caroms off the trembling walls, we see both her and Harry reflected in a MIRROR. He leaps, sweeping her toward the smoldering window. As they pitch themselves into the night, the mirror EXPLODES and shards of glass, reflecting bits of Hermione and Harry and the giant snake, tumble in the night, slowly vanishing into... nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weirdly quiet. Like the memory of a day long ago. A lone figure -- Hermione -- walks from the river to the woods, a pail of water in hand, leaving silent footprints in the FROST that glitters on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS. For a moment, we hear nothing. Then, Hermione’s voice SOFTLY WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Harry... Harry, can you hear me...?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good. That’s good... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 9

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We got away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 139 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 97

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m fine. But you’ve been sick. Rest... Rest a bit more... All stays DARK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione sits reading a BOOK by the fire. The hillside is glorious, overlooking a vast valley.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You've outdone yourself this time. Hermione turns, finds Harry standing outside the tent, admiring the view. He looks pale, battle-worn.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The Forest of Dean. I came here once with my mum and dad, years ago. It’s just how I remember it. The trees. The river. It’s like nothing’s changed. Not true, of course. Everything’s changed. If I brought my parents here, they wouldn’t recognize any of it. Not the trees. Not the river. Not... me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Wendell and Monica Wilkens now reside happily in Sydney, Australia. They have two dogs, run a small sweet shop, but floss daily. No children. She smiles, then it fades.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just stay here, Harry. Grow old. Harry has no words. She inhales, shakes off her tears. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 9

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You wanted to know who the boy in the photograph was. Well, I know. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hermione holds up the book in her lap: The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It was in Bathilda’s sitting room. Rita Skeeter had sent it to her. Harry, it doesn’t make for very nice reading --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who is he, Hermione? The thief? Did Dumbledore know him?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: For a time.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tell me, Hermione. Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Gellert Grindelwald. He’s not very well known in Britain, but there was a time, before You-Know- Who...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, I don’t need to have read A History of Magic to know who Gellert Grindelwald is. Hermione nods, hands him the book, open to a PHOTOGRAPH of a TEENAGED DUMBLEDORE laughing with another BOY (GELLERT GRINDELWALD). The caption: “For the Greater Good? Dark Days; Dumbledore and Grindelwald.” On the opposite page is a PHOTOGRAPH of Grindelwald in later days, clad in black, holding a JAGGED WAND -- no longer the carefree lad of youth.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: When Grindelwald was seventeen, he was expelled from Durmstrang. He’d started doing some twisted things at school -- experiments. A few teachers had always protected him, but they couldn't anymore. After he left, he traveled for awhile, then ended up in Godric’s Hollow where his great aunt lived, Bathilda Bagshot. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 9

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get to the hard part, Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: She introduced him to Dumbledore. It made sense. Dumbledore’s mother had just died, Grindelwald was troubled and they were both brilliant -- they’d never really had anyone they could talk to on the same level. They did a lot of talking that summer. But they always returned to one particular subject. Harry looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Wizard rule over Muggles.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And Dumbledore believed in it?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. Harry nods, looking at the photograph again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘For the Greater Good.’ What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It was something Dumbledore came up with. He believed wizards were superior and should rule over Muggles, but gently, for their own good. Grindelwald took a more violent position. Harry shakes his head, staring at the book.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It was a different time, Harry. It was one summer. Dumbledore was young --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're young, Hermione. And here we are, risking our lives to fight against the very thing Dumbledore supported. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 9

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He changed, Harry. Years later, it was Dumbledore who put Grindelwald in prison. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry stares at the photograph of the laughing thief one last moment, then tosses the book away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where’s my wand? I’11 take the watch. Hermione hesitates. Her expression makes him apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione. Where’s my wand? She points. There, lying by the fire, is a shattered stick. He picks it up gently, sees that it is nearly severed in two. One fragile strand of phoenix feather holds it together.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s my fault. As we were leaving Godric’s Hollow, I cast a curse and it rebounded... I’m sorry, Harry, I tried to mend it but wands are different --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s done.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Maybe we can --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s done. His tone puts an end to it. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Leave me yours. You get back in the warm. And give me that. Harry gestures to the locket. Hermione starts to speak, then simply hands it over. She starts to leave, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He loved you, Harry. I know he loved you. She trails her fingers lightly over his hair, and he closes his eyes. We --

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 140 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is merely embers. Harry sits with a frost- encrusted blanket draped over his shoulders, staring bitterly into the dark forest. The silence is eerie, SHADOWS play in the trees. He peers through the tent flap and sees Hermione slumbering in the light of a SMALL BOWL of FLAMES. Then, slowly, LIGHT CRAWLS briefly over the tent canvas and he turns, peers into the forest once more. Something seems to GLIMMER FAINTLY, but so briefly as to seem a trick of the eye. The air is cold, gives texture to the darkness, makes it a living thing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 141 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And then it is there again, the LIGHT -- pure and bright and silver and moving through the trees toward him. Harry rises and the blanket slithers off his shoulders. Gripping Hermione’s wand, he watches the LIGHT drift closer, then shatter throughout the trees, momentarily blinding. And then it appears... «+. a SILVER-WHITE DOE, moon-bright and dazzling. It gazes at Harry and he stands, transfixed. And then the doe turns away. His voice cracks:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST CRUNCHES beneath Harry’s feet as he dashes through the trees in pursuit of the silent doe up ahead, breath streaming from his lungs. She leads him deep into the forest until, finally, she stops, as does Harry. As he watches, she turns her beautiful head toward him... and vanishes. For a moment, a GHOST IMAGE of her, like a retina burn, hangs in the air and then Harry is plunged into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos ! Hermione’s wand-tip ignites. Harry paints the clearing with light and something GLEAMS: a small FROZEN POOL. He crosses to it, looks down. He sees his own image reflected dully and then, deeper, within, a SILVER CROSS. He looks closer. It is the SWORD OF GRYFFINDOR. Harry steps back, blinks. It’s still there. He glances about, painting the trees with light, looking to insure he is alone, then casts light upon the pool once more.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Accio Sword. Nothing. Harry walks about the pool again and again and then stops. He crouches... .-+. and looks slowly down at his chest. The Horcrux around his neck has begun to TWITCH. Harry places his fingers upon it briefly, then rises. Quickly, with fumbling fingers, he SHEDS his clothes and points Hermione’s wand at the pool. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 141 142 143 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Diffindo. The pool’s icey crust CRACKS, echoing in the silence. CHUNKS of DARK ICE rock the surface. Harry steps to the pool's edge, peers within... and PLUNGES...

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: ++. SCREAMING in the dark silence of the chill water. He kicks down to the glimmering sword, grabs the hilt and kicks for the surface when... -.. the locket’s chain begins to COIL, tightening like a SNAKE about his neck. As the links bite into his throat, he releases the sword and begins to thrash about, struggling to get his fingers under the chain. Realizing it’s no use... .»+. he reaches for the pool’s edge, his fingers scrabbling desperately over the ice, but unable to gain purchase. Slowly, his hands go limp and slip from the ice back into... -.. the water, where he drifts slowly down, a slow trail of bubbles escaping his mouth, eyes half-closed as he peers upward, watching as the surface of the water grows slowly calm... peaceful... when... a SHADOW appears and... .».. a PAIR of HANDS shatter the glassy surface of the water and Harry is pulled upward and out, landing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +. face-down on the frigid ground, choking and retching.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione... A HAND reaches in, strips the locket from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Are -- you -- mental? Harry's eyes pop open. Standing a few yards away, fully dressed and half-drenched, clutching the sword of -- Gryffindor in one hand and the locket in the other, is Ron. Harry just stares, then begins to pull on his clothes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was you!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. Bit obvious, I'd think.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And the doe. That was you as well.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. I reckoned it was you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My Patronus is a stag.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Right. Antlers. Ron brings his arms up, vaguely pantomiming antlers, but the effect is lost, what with the sword and locket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You didn’t see anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, I... I did think maybe I saw something -- when I was running -- over there -- Harry crosses to a pair of OAKS grown close together.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) But I reckon whoever cast the doe, put the sword in that pool hoping we'd find it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And we did, didn’t we? The “we” hangs in the chill air. Harry eyes Ron, then steps forward and dangles the locket close to the sword. It immediately begins to TWITCH.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: See that? It knows. It’s afraid. (looking up) Do it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What? No. Harry. That thing’s bad for me. I can’t handle it. I’m not making excuses for how I acted, but that thing affects me more than it affects you and Hermione. It made me think stuff -- stuff I was thinking anyway, but it made everything worse.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All the more reason.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. I can’t --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then why are you here? Why did you come back? Harry's tone is hard, meant to wound. This stops Ron. He steps back, grips the sword with both hands. Harry nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'll have to speak to it in order for it to open. When it does, don’t hesitate. I don’t know what’s in here, but it’1l put up a fight. The bit of Riddle that was in his diary tried to kill me. Ron nods and then Harry sweeps a layer of frost froma flat rock, lays the locket down.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: On three. One. Two. Three. (in Parseltongue) Take me inside... Click! The twin doors of the locket SNAP open. Behind each glass window a LIVING EYE blinks -- Tom Riddle’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Stab it, Ron. Now. Ron raises his trembling hands, poises the sword. Then a VOICE hisses from the Horcrux.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I have seen your heart and it is mine... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to it.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have seen your dreams, Ronald Weasley, and I have seen your fears...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron. Don’t listen to it!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Least loved, by the mother who craved a daughter. Least loved, by the girl who prefers your friend...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron. Stab it! The locket QUIVERS in Harry’s fingers, turning WHITE-HOT, and he releases it. As the eyes gleam SCARLET, Harry grimaces and a FLASH OF BLINDING LIGHT BURSTS forth, leaving in its wake two FIGURES floating in the darkness -- GHOST IMAGES of Harry and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLE-HARRY
dialogues.text: We were better without you, happier without you.

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLE-HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Who could look at you beside Harry Potter? What are you, compared with the Chosen One...? Ron stands transfixed, sword in hand, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron. It lies! Stab it! STAB IT!

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLE-HARRY
dialogues.text: Your mother confessed that she would have preferred me as a son...

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLE-HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Who wouldn’t prefer him, what woman would take you, you are nothing, nothing, nothing to him... The ghostly Hermione, frightening yet beautiful, entwines herself around the ghostly Harry, her hair running like silk over their faces as she leans forward and covers his mouth with hers. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 144 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do it, Ron! Kill it! Ron’s head turns then, to Harry, and Harry freezes. A trace of SCARLET glints in Ron’s eyes. He raises the sword high and -- for a moment -- Harry looks fearful. Then, Ron pivots and brings the blade down hard, cleaving the locket. A SCREAM echoes throughout the forest and the ghostly Harry and Hermione turn to dust, becoming one with the vapor drifting from Ron’s mouth and all is... Quiet. Harry eyes the shattered locket, then turns his gaze on Ron who stands alone, sword dangling from the end of his arm, chest heaving. Harry scoops up the locket and examines it. Riddle’s eyes are gone, the silk lining stained and faintly smoking. Ron lets the sword fall to the ground, drops to his knees. Harry steps forward and -- carefully -- places a hand upon his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: After you left, she cried for a week. She’s like my sister.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry I left.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You've sort of made up for it tonight. Getting the sword. Finishing off the Horcrux.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Saving your life.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That too. They both stare at the remains of the locket.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And just think of it. Only three to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowl of flames boils timidly now; Hermione still slumbers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hermione! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 145 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She stirs, sits up. Pushing her hair out of her face, she peers through the tent flap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sticks the sword in the ground. As Hermione emerges, she blinks against the brightness of the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fine. Actually... more than fine. He steps aside and Hermione sees Ron, standing at the edge of the camp. She stares, mute, then walks past Harry and the ashes of the campfire, stopping right in front of Ron. He raises a hand, smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hey. And then... Hermione begins to PUNCH HIM.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wo -- hey -- ouch!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (with each punch) You -- complete -- arse -- Ronald -- Weasley! You crawl back here after all these weeks and say, ‘Hey?’ (turning to Harry) Where’s my wand? Harry, where’s my wand! Harry places his hand over his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Um... I don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry Potter, you give me my wand!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How come he’s got your wand?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Never mind why he’s got my wand -- (stopping) What is that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She stares at the blackened locket dangling in Ron’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You destroyed it? Hermione glances at Harry. He indicates Ron. She turns back to Ron. He nods. She starts to speak when her eyes shift, see the sword stuck in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And exactly how is it you have the Sword of Gryffindor?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s a long story. Hermione ponders this, baffled, then looks back at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t think this changes anything.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, of course not. I only destroyed a bloody freaking Horcrux! Why would that change anything! Do you know what it was like for me to hear those words coming from you! To see you doing those things -- Ron stops.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: See me doing what things? Ron blinks, mortified. Hermione turns to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What happened out there?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (at a loss, then) It’s a long story.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Look, I wanted to come back the minute I'd left. I just... didn’t know how to find you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Exactly how did you find us?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: With this. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron reaches into his pocket, pulls out the Deluminator. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It doesn’t just turn off lights. I don’t know exactly how it works, but Christmas morning I -- I was sleeping -- in this little pub-- I'd given some Snatchers the slip the night before, me being a blood- traitor and all -- anyway, I was sleeping when I heard it...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: A voice. Ron turns to Hermione, holds up the Deluminator.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Your voice, Hermione. Coming out of this.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And what may I ask did I say?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: My name. Just my name. Like a whisper. Hermione stands perfectly still... and blushes.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So I took this and I clicked it and this tiny ball of light appeared. And I knew.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Knew what?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Just knew. On account of Hermione’s voice. And sure enough, it floated toward me, the ball of light, right to my chest and then -- went straight through -- right here. Ron touches a point close to his heart.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I could feel it inside me. It was warm, like the first sip of a good cup of tea. And I knew it would take me where I needed to go. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I Disapparated and came out on this hillside. It was dark. I didn’t have any idea where I was. I just had to hope one of you would show yourselves in the end. And you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lies in his bunk while Ron sits cross-legged, warming his hands over a bowl of FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’ve always liked it. These flames Hermione makes. Harry peers at the bowl, then beyond the tent flap, sees Hermione sitting just outside, keeping watch.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How long you reckon she'll stay mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Keep talking ‘bout that little ball of light touching your heart -- she’ll come round.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It was true. Every word. (a beat) You're going to think I’m mental, but I think that’s why Dumbledore left it to me -- the Deluminator. I think he knew that at some point I'd... need to find my way back. And she’d lead me. Harry eyes Ron, pondering this. Then suddenly, Ron jumps up, grabs his own rucksack and begins to fish through it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. I just realized. You need a wand, right?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve got one. Here. It’s Blackthorn, ten inches, nothing special, but I reckon it’ll do. I took it off a Snatcher a few weeks back. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don’t tell Hermione, but they’re a bit dim, Snatchers. This one was definitely part Troll. The smell off him... Harry points the wand at the flames. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Engorgio. The flames FLARE MASSIVELY and Ron leaps back.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wo.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Reducio! As the flames subside, Ron pats down a small flare-up on the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’s going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY/RON
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Maybe a bit more practice, eh?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Ron wheels, sees Hermione standing in the mouth of the tent, Life and Lies in hand, looking at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) I want to go and see Xenophilius Lovegood.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: See this? It’s a letter Dumbledore wrote to Grindelwald. Look at the signature. It’s the mark again. Hermione turns the book in Harry’s direction. Dumbledore replaced the “A” in Albus with the TRIANGULAR EYE.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It keeps cropping up. Here. In Beedle the Bard. In the graveyard in Godric’s Hollow -- what? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 148 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hermione looks at Harry, who is staring hard at the book. Suddenly, we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. MOVING through the village streets again, PAST the cloaked figures, turning down the narrowing alleyway that leads toward Gregorovitch’s wand shop and... HOLDING on the TRIANGULAR SYMBOL scratched crudely into the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry blinks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jesus. It was there too.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Outside Gregorovitch’s wand shop. on the alley wall...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But what does it mean? They all look down at the symbol etched in Dumbledore’s fine hand in the book.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, you don’t have a clue where the next Horcrux is. And neither do I. But this, this means something. I’m sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I think Hermione’s right. I think we ought to go and see Lovegood. What say we vote on it? Those in favor... Ron’s hand flies into the air. Harry eyes him knowingly. Hermione rolls her eyes, then lifts her hand as well.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Sorry, Harry. Looks like it’s Hermione and me this time.  149 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hangs low over a hillside gloriously free of snow. Ron leads the way, far ahead of Harry and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not still mad at him, are you?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I’m always mad at him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As we RISE, a STRANGE-LOOKING HOUSE appears in the distance, etched like a great black cylinder against the sky. Seeing it, Ron turns back, GRINNING as he calls out.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Luna? Harry and Hermione take a look.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY /HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Luna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN is tacked to a door studded with nails: “THE QUIBBLER. EDITOR: X. LOVEGOOD. Hermione raps three times.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Keep off the dirigible plums. Hermione turns, gives him an odd look. Ron points to a SIGN: “KEEP OFF THE DIRIGIBLE PLUMS.” Just then, the door swings open and Xenophilius Lovegood appears, barefoot, wearing a soiled nightshirt.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: (to Hermione) What is it? (to Ron) Who are you? (to Harry) What do you want -- Seeing Harry, Lovegood’s jaw goes slack in shock.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Lovegood. I’m Harry Potter. We met a few months back? Lovegood’s eyes drift to Harry’s scar.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Would it be okay if we came in? It won’t take long, sir. I promise.  151 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great tottering towers of Quibbler back-issues rise to the ceiling while an old-fashioned WOODEN PRINTING PRESS chugs away in the center of the room, spitting out new ones.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Excuse me. As Lovegood steps to the wheezing press, the trio glance at past QUIBBLERS laying about: MUGGLE MURDERS RISE,

dialogues.speaker: QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP CANCELLED AMID DEATH THREATS.
dialogues.text: Abruptly, the press goes silent and Lovegood turns.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: So. What brings you here, Mr. Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, sir, we need some help.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Ah. Help. I see. Yes, well, the thing is, helping Harry Potter, rather dangerous these days... The trio exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Aren’t you the one who keeps telling everyone it’s their first duty to help Harry?

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: I have expressed that view, yes. In the past. Would you excuse me one moment. I shall return shortly and, um, try to help you... Lovegood dashes from the room.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He’s mental. Let’s face it. Luna’s always good value, but she’s nutty as squirrel poo. Just then, Hermione GASPS, points to an ENORMOUS SPIRAL HORN mounted on the wall. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Do you see that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, of course. It’s massive, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No! Don’t go near it! Harry stops.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s an Erumpent horn. It’s a Class B Tradeable Material. Harry and Ron exchange a “she’s mental” glance.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, all right... Just then, Lovegood returns with a TRAY rattling with CUPS.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: May I offer you all an infusion of Gurdyroots? We make it ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where is Luna, sir?

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Luna? Oh, um, she’ll be along. Now how can I help you, Mr. Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, sir, it’s about something you were wearing around your neck at the wedding. A symbol...

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: You mean this? Lovegood reaches into his nightshirt and pulls out the chain with the TRIANGULAR EYE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes! Exactly. What we wondered, sir, is, well, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: What is it? Well, it’s the sign of the Deathly Hallows, of course.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY /RON/HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The what? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 152 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: The Deathly Hallows. I assume you're all familiar with ‘The Tale of the Three Brothers?’

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE/RON HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes. No. Harry looks at the others, then Hermione reaches into her beaded bag and pulls out The Tales of Beedle the Bard.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s in here.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Well, there’s no real reason to go on unless one is familiar with the tale. Why don’t you read it aloud, Miss...?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Granger. Well... all right. (opening the book) There were once three brothers who were traveling along a lonely, winding road at twilight --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Midnight. Mum always said midnight. (as Hermione glowers) But twilight’s fine. Better actually.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: In time, the brothers reached a river too treacherous to pass... As Hermione continues, Lovegood looks out the window. A CROW cycles INTO VIEW and we FOLLOW it, the sky DARKENING...

dialogues.speaker: STORY
dialogues.text: ++. aS the crow swoops over a river to reveal THREE SILHOUETTES.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But being learned in the magical arts, the three brothers simply waved their wands and made a bridge. They were halfway across it when they found their path blocked by a hooded figure. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BRIDGE MAGICALLY MATERIALIZES and the three figures begin to cross, when the HOODED FIGURE appears.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was Death and he felt cheated, for travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning. He granted each brother a wish for their cleverness. The oldest, who was a combative man, asked for a wand more powerful than any in existence. So Death fashioned one from an elder tree on the banks of the river. All of this is dramatized in surreal silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The second brother, who was an arrogant man, asked for the power to recall others from Death. So Death plucked a stone from the river. Finally Death turned to the third brother. A humble man, he asked for something that would make him disappear. And so it was that Death handed over his own Cloak of Invisibility. Death then stepped aside and the brothers went their separate ways... We see the brothers cross the bridge, and part.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first brother traveled to a distant village where, with Elder Wand in hand, he killed a wizard with whom he had once quarreled. Proceeding to an Inn, he bragged of his invincibility. But that very night... We see a wizard, in shadow, slip into a room, KNIFE in hand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: +. another wizard crept upon him as he lay sleeping. He took the Elder Wand... and slit the brother’s throat for good measure. And so Death took the first brother for his own... We see the second brother approach a cottage. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his home, where he took out the stone and turned it thrice in hand. To his delight, the girl he had once hoped to Marry before her untimely death appeared before him. Yet soon she turned sad and cold, for she did not belong in the mortal world. Driven mad with hopeless longing, the second brother killed himself so as to join her. And so Death took the second brother... We see Death etched upon a bleak hillside.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As for the third brother, Death searched for many years but was never able to find him. Only when he had attained a great age did the youngest brother shed the Cloak of Invisibility and give it to his son. He then greeted Death as an old friend and went with him gladly, departing this life as equals... As Death and the third brother retreat, the crow returns, beating into the sky, which LIGHTENS, and we PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to find Xenophilius Lovegood staring out the window. The sun has nearly vanished over the lip of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Well, there you are. Those are the Deathly Hallows.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry... I still don’t really understand... Lovegood turns and, taking quill and parchment, draws a STRAIGHT VERTICAL LINE...

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: The Elder Wand... ++. then adds a CIRCLE on top of the line... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 11

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: The Resurrection Stone... ..+. then encloses both in a TRIANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: The Cloak of Invisibility. Together... they make the Deathly Hallows. Together... they make one master of Death. The trio stare at the symbol.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Mr. Lovegood, does the Peverell family have anything to do with the Deathly Hallows? (to Harry and Ron) That was the name on the grave with the mark on it in Godric’s Hollow. Ignotus Peverell.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Ignotus and his brothers Cadmus and Antioch are thought to be the original owners of the Hallows and therefore the inspiration for the story. Lovegood’s focus abruptly wavers, sadness in his eyes, then he blinks, eyes the tea kettle.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Ah, but your tea’s grown cold. Excuse me, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (as Lovegood exits) Let’s get out of here once he’s back. I’m not touching this stuff, hot or cold.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (lost in thought) Which one would you choose if you could? Of the Deathly Hallows?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It’s obvious, isn’t it? All three speak at once: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: RON HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The Wand. The Cloak.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Stone. They glance at each other, amused.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're supposed to say the Cloak, but who wants to spend all day being invisible. Dead boring if you ask me. But an unbeatable wand!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Its owner grew drunk with power and was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, but imagine what a short wicked life you'd lead.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) Why the Stone, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, you could bring people back, couldn’t you? Mad-Eye. Dumbledore. Sirius. Anybody.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (gentle But according to the story they don’t want to come back. It’s all rubbish anyway. There’s no such thing as the Deathly Hallows.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I have one. The Invisibility Cloak my father left me.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: There have always been Cloaks --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Not like Harry’s. I’ve seen a fair few. Dad used to bring home the ones the Ministry confiscated from petty thieves and the like. They always got holes or tears. Harry's is different. It’s perfect. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 1

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And I think I’ve actually held the Resurrection Stone in my hands, that night in Dumbledore’s office when he showed me the ring he’d destroyed, the Horcrux. It hada symbol on it. Now I think it was the mark of the Hallows. The trio stand silently when Lovegood returns.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Mr. Lovegood. Thank you, sir --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You forgot the water.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: The water?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: For the tea.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Did, didn’t I? How silly of me.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No matter, sir. We really ought to be go--

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: No, you mustn’t --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: You're my only hope. They were angry, you see, about what I’d been writing, so they took her. They took my Luna... (eyes finding Harry) But it’s really you they want...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who took her, sir? Hermione eyes the printing press. A copy of the Quibbler lies stuck under a roller. She reaches out, pulls it free, the INK STREAKING over the cover, over HARRY’S FACE and the BLAZING HEADLINE: UNDESIRABLE NUMBER #1. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 154 155 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Him. Surely you call him You-Know- Who. But his real name of course is... Voldemort.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Nooooooooo! Instantly, out the window, FIGURES on BROOMSTICKS appear in the sky, jetting directly toward the house. As Harry, Ron and Hermione hit the floor, ROPES of LIGHT ricochet off the windowsill. The printing press EXPLODES, raining Quibblers everywhere, like a flock of doves, smoking with flames. Lovegood waves madly from the window.

dialogues.speaker: XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: Stop! I’ve got him -- Lovegood is blasted off his feet by a Stunning Spell so great the chain around his neck flies across the room and settles at Harry’s feet. Harry glances down, watches the symbol of the Deathly Hallows dissolve like mercury, then looks up, sees Lovegood streak out the door.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! Harry! Take my hand! Harry and Ron begin to crawl on their knees toward Hermione when another volley of spells ricochet about the room and -- ping! -- strike the Gurdyroot teapot. As Hermione watches, it flies into the air, tumbling end over end toward the Erumpent Horn. Harry’s hand closes on hers, Ron reaches out and... .+. the teapot strikes the Erumpent Horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a COLOSSAL EXPLOSION. The second floor of the black cylinder ruptures. Quibblers belch into the air like confetti as Lovegood narrowly escapes and the Death Eaters are engulfed and Harry, Ron and Hermione...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. tumble INTO VIEW and roll to their feet, barely visible in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: That treacherous old bleeder! Is there no one we can trust! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 156 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (softly) They've kidnapped Luna because he supported me. He was just desperate. Ron says nothing, then SPITS, clearing the grit from his teeth and peers toward the river. Unlike the raging force it was the last time they were here, it is little more than a trickle now. The trees are eerily quiet.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’1l do the enchantments. Ron takes out his wand... when Hermione raises her hand, stopping him. Her eyes rise. Her breath catches. Ron and Harry look. Clinging to the branches of the trees above, almost as if a part of the trees themselves, are... SNATCHERS . A wand BLOOMS above, illuminates the face of Scabior. Hermione’s red scarf, now faded and filthy, dangles from his neck. He presses it to his grimy nose, inhales and GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Hello, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and Hermione DASH through the trees. As they diverge, we CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN THE THREE: Hermione, swift as the wind, flickers through the trees as Scabior pursues her. Harry slashes through the river, looks up, and sees a Snatcher leap across the divide from one tree to another. Ron pounds through thick brush, over a fallen tree. The forest grows more dense, the shadows thicken. Spells splinter through the trees, ropes of light lace the night. Hermione stumbles, regains her footing, finds herself in a clearing. Another figure pelts toward her: Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 157 158 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They freeze briefly, then the clearing explodes with light as spells ricochet. They hit the ground. Hear the Snatchers closing in. Harry looks to Hermione. The TIP of her WAND GLOWS and her face blooms in the darkness, looking mildly demonic. She reaches out, STRIPS HIS GLASSES FROM HIS FACE, then points her wand... at him. A BURST of WHITE LIGHT strikes him in the eyes. As her wand goes dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-. he is flying toward a fortress, gliding around the high walls, up to the topmost window of the highest tower. He passes through the window -- little more than a slit -- and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-. finds a SKELETAL FIGURE lying beneath a ragged blanket. The figure stirs, looks up, and grins with broken teeth. It is the young man -- the thief -- grown old. Grindelwald.

dialogues.speaker: GRINDELWALD
dialogues.text: Ah, Tom, I thought you would come one day. But surely you must know I no longer have what you seek... A SHADOW -- Voldemort’s -- falls across Grindelwald.

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: If not you, then who?

dialogues.speaker: GRINDELWALD
dialogues.text: You’re so innocent, Tom. Like a schoolboy. There’s so much you don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT
dialogues.text: Tell me, Grindelwald. Tell me where to find it! Tell me who possesses it! The name, Grindelwald! The name!

dialogues.speaker: GRINDELWALD
dialogues.text: Can’t you guess, Tom? It lies with him, of course. Buried within the earth. It is he who possesses it, even in death. Your old friend and mine... Dumbledore.  159 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry blinks and IN A (SWOLLEN) BLUR peers at Hermione,

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They exist. The Hallows. Hermione looks at him expectantly. He nods, his FACE SHROUDED IN SHADOW, BARELY VISIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But he only wants the one, the last one. That’s what he’s been looking for.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’re you saying?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He knows where it is, You-Know- Who. He'll have it by the end of the night. He’s found the Elder Wand. As Hermione stares in stunned disbelief, figures emerge from the trees. Ron is shoved to the ground next to them. Scabior strips Harry and Hermione of their wands.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Don’t touch her! A fist hits Ron hard. It’s GREYBACK.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend’1l get worse than that if he doesn’t behave, lovely. Scabior paints her face with light then casts it on Harry. Harry peers up, his eyes SWOLLEN to slits, his face HORRIBLY MISSHAPEN.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: What happened to you, ugly? Harry’s hand finds his face, feels the lumps.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dudely. Vernon Dudley. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Check the list. And you, ginger?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Stan Shunpike.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Like ‘ell you are. We know skinny Stan. Try again. Greyback, his boot to Ron’s neck, presses harder.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Weasley... (making it up) Barney Weasley.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Weasley, eh? Wouldn’t be related to that blood traitor Arthur Weasley, would you?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Piss off! Arthur Weasley’s ten times the wizard you are!

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Worth ten times you if I can find him. Wasn't you that tipped him off, was it? Ron stays mute. Scabior turns to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you, lovely? What do they call you...?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Penelope Clearwater. Half-blood. Scabior strokes the nape of Hermione’s neck, then takes her hair in hand, sniffs it.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: You smell like vanilla, Penelope. I think you’re going to be my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: SNATCHER
dialogues.text: There’s no Vernon Dudley on ‘ere. Reluctantly, Scabior turns from Hermione to Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 160 161 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: FENRIR GREYBACK
dialogues.text: Hear that, ugly? The list says you're lying. How come you don’t want us to know who you are? Hm?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The list is wrong. I told you who Iam -- Scabior puts a finger to his lips, silencing Harry, his wand probing Harry’s face more closely.

dialogues.speaker: SCABIOR
dialogues.text: Change of plans, boys. We won’t be taking this lot to the Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sea of treetops shift eerily below as we sweep over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scabior and the others escort Harry, Ron and Hermione past the yew hedges. Hermione eyes the white peacock, looking like a ghostly lawn ornament. Harry WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What did you put on me?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: A Stinging Jinx.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How long will it last?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Not long. Harry glances down, sees his GLASSES cupped in Hermione’s palm. As he slips them into his pocket, the group suddenly slows. Up ahead, on the other side of the gate, BELLATRIX, LUCIUS and NARCISSA approach. Scabior grabs Harry's arm, pushes his face up to the iron bars. Bellatrix steps close.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Show me. Scabior reaches out and pushes Harry’s hair off his forehead. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY... - PT. 1 - Rev. 6/11/10 12

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bellatrix points her wand, illuminating the skin. Slowly, she smiles. Despite the swelling, one intriguing feature can be seen. A SCAR. In the shape of a LIGHTNING BOLT? We HOLD, then... CUT TO BLACK.
